column1: English: When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. = Yoruba: Nígbàtí àwọn èèyàn tó wà níbùgbé bá ní ìdánimọ̀ to ní í se pẹ̀lú ìjọra jíìnì, wọ́n má ń pèwọ́n ní oníjọra. ### English: If visiting a formally arranged garden, collecting "specimens" is also going to get you ejected, without discussion. = Yoruba:
column2: Ti o ba lo gba specimeni nigba ti o ba lo be ogba ti won ti to, won maa le e kuro lai koko ba e soro.
column3: Bí o bá lọ sí ilé tí wọ́n ti ṣe àyẹ̀wò, ó lè jẹ́ pé o kò ní gba àyè láti gba àwọn ohun tí wọ́n bá gbé jáde.

column1: English: In the heat of the day, travelers can experience mirages that give the illusion of water (or other things). = Yoruba: Nínú gbogbo rògbòdìyàn òní, àwọn arìnrìn àjò lè ní ìrírí òmìrán tí ó dábí omi (tàbí àwọn ǹkan míràn). ### English: Officials for the city of Amsterdam and the Anne Frank Museum state that the tree is infected with a fungus and poses a public health hazard as they argue that it was in imminent danger of falling over. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn òsìsé ìlú Amsterdam àti ti Musiomu Anne Frank fi síta wípé igi náà ti kó ààrùn àwọn kòkòrò tí a lè fojúrí tí o si léwu fún ìlera ara ìlú gẹ́gẹ́ bí wọn se se àtẹnumọ́ wípé o lè fa ìjàmbà lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ nípa wíwó lulẹ̀.
column3: Agbófinró fún ìlú Amsterdam àti ilé-ìwé Anne Frank sọ pé igi náà ní àrùn tí ó ń mú kí igi ó di àìmọ́, tí ó sì ń fa àìmọ́ fún àwọn ènìyàn nítorí pé ó ti ń di àìmọ́.

column1: English: "We were all simply in shock," the mother stated. = Yoruba: “Gbogbo wa ló yà lẹ́nu,” lohun tí ìyá sọ. ### English: Travellers bound for countries with heavy taxation can sometimes save a considerable amount of money, especially on products such as alcoholic beverages and tobacco. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn tó ń lọ sí àwọn orílẹ̀ tí wọ́n tí ń sanwó orí gegere nígbà míràn lè fí owó tó pọ̀ pamọ̀, pàápàá lórí ìpèsè bí i ọtí, ẹlẹ́rìndòdò àti tábà.
column3: Àwọn oníbàárà tí wọ́n ń lọ sí àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí wọ́n ń fi owó orí tó pọ̀ ṣọṣẹ́ lè rí owó tí ó tó láti fi ra àwọn ohun èlò bíi èméle àti tábà, pàápàá jùlọ àwọn ohun èlò tí wọ́n ń lò fún ìdárayá.

column1: English: The media companies routinely lie about the purpose of this, claiming that it is to "prevent piracy". = Yoruba: Iléẹṣẹ́ agbéròyìnjáde ma ń parọ́ nípa èyí, sọ pé ó wà láti “dènà jíjí iṣẹ́ ọpọlọ”. ### English: Danielle Lantagne, a UN expert on the disease, stated the outbreak was likely caused by the peacekeepers. = Yoruba:
column2: Danielle Lantagne, tí oh jẹ́ ògbóntarìgì fún UN lórí àìsàn, sọ pé àwọn onílàjà ni ó ṣe e ṣe kí wọn fa àjàkálẹ̀ ná.
column3: Danielle Lantagne, olùkọ́ni UN lórí àrùn náà, sọ pé àrùn náà ti jẹ́ kí ó jẹ́ pé àwọn ọmọ ogun tí ó wà níbí ló mú àrùn náà wá.

column1: English: The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. = Yoruba: Òṣèrè tó wẹ omi díẹ̀, tàbí mú orí ẹgbẹ́ rl wù, láti parí ìdíje náà. ### English: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. = Yoruba:

column1: English: One of the panes finally broke, and they started to get out by the window," said survivor Franciszek Kowal. = Yoruba: Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn gíláàsì fèrèsé padà fọ́, wọ́n sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń gba ojù fèrèsé náà jáde,” Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn tó yè Franciszek Kowal ló sọ bẹ́ẹ̀. ### English: He produced over 1,000 stamps for Sweden and 28 other countries. = Yoruba:

column3: Ó ṣe àgbéjáde àwo-orí ẹ̀rí fún Suedia àti àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè 28 míràn.

column1: English: Student visas generally have different requirements and application procedures from normal tourist or business visas. = Yoruba: Ìwé ìrìnnà àwọn akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ má ń ní àlàkalẹ̀ tó dá yàtọ̀ sáwọn arìnrìn afẹ́ lásán àtàwọn ìwé ìrìnnà okoòwò. ### English: NextGen is a system the FAA claims would allow aircraft to fly shorter routes and save millions of gallons of fuel each year and cut carbon emissions. = Yoruba:
column2: NextGen jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí FAA sọ pé wọ́n ma fàyègba ọks òfurufú láti fo ní ibi ti kò jìnà wan sì ma tọ̀jú gálanù epo.
column3: Ìkánjújú ni ètò FAA ti sọ pé yóò mú kí ọkọ̀ òfurufú ó máa rìnrìn ní ọ̀nà tí ó kéré jù, ó sì máa mú kí wọ́n ó máa fi mílíọ́nù kan àádọ́ta gálóó di ọdún ó sì máa mú kí ó dín àwọn òfurufú tí ó ń mú òórùn dídùn jáde kù.

column1: English: Jonny Reid, co-driver for the A1GP New Zealand team, today made history by driving the fastest over the 48-year-old Auckland Harbour Bridge, New Zealand, legally. = Yoruba: Jonny Reid tó jẹ́ alájọwà fún ikọ̀ A1GP New Zealand lónìí sàkọọ́lẹ̀ ìtàn nípa yíyára wakọ̀ ju Auckland Harbour Bridge ẹni ọdún méjìdínláàdọ́ta ti ilẹ̀ New Zealand níbàmún un pẹ̀lú òfin. ### English: The early reports say the plane was diverted back to Afghanistan after being denied an emergency landing in Ürümqi. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìròyìn àárọ̀ ní wọ́n dá ọkọ̀ ojú òfúrufú lọ sí Afghanistan lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n dùn wọ́n ní ìbalẹ̀ pàjáwìrì ní Ürümqi.
column3: Àtẹ̀jáde tó wá láti ìta gbangba sọ pé ọkọ̀ náà ti di àtúnṣe padà sí Afghanistan lẹ́yìn tí wọ́n ti kọ̀ láti gba ọkọ̀ náà sí Uromqi.

column1: English: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. = Yoruba: Wọ́n lè ṣeré eré ìdárayá ìjà ẹlẹ́ni mẹ́ta ìgbàlódé ní ìpele méta, láti akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó wà ní ilé ẹ̀kọ́ àgbà sí àkọ́ṣkmọṣẹ́ àti ìdíje Olympics. ### English: Also the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no Tsunami indication. = Yoruba:
column2: Bákanáà Ibùdó Ìkìls Pacific Tsunami sọ pé kò sí ìtọ́kasí Tsunami.
column3: A tún lè fi hàn pé kò sí àmì tó fi hàn pé ó ti ṣẹ̀ ní ìpele ìpele.

column1: English: Attention Deficit Disorder "is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy". = Yoruba: Attention Deficit Disorder, ni ààrùn ọpọlọ tí o máa ń fa kí ènìyàn máa ní àwọn àpẹẹrẹ bí wérewère, wọ́nranwọ̀nran, ránhunràun, àti wàìwàì tàbí gànràngànrà.” ### English: Her first was the Slalom, where she earned a Did Not Finish in her first run. 36 of the 116 competitors had the same result in that race. = Yoruba:
column2: Esi re akoko ni Slalom, ni ibi ti o ti gba esi wipe ko pari idije. Merindinlogoji ninu awon olukopa merindinlogofa ni o ni esi kanna ninu idije naa.
column3: Ó di àkọ́kọ́ nínú eré Slalom, tí ó sì gba Did Not Finish nínú àkọ́kọ́ rẹ̀. 36 nínú àwọn 116 olùdíje náà ní àkọ́kọ́ náà.

column1: English: Protesters hope to collect a petition of 1.2 million signatures to present to the National Congress in November. = Yoruba: Àwọn afẹ̀hohnúhàn lérò láti gba ìfọwọ́bọ̀wé tó tó 1.2 miliọnu láti fi ṣọwọ́ sí àpérò orílẹ̀èdè ni oṣu kejìl. ### English: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon". = Yoruba:
column2: Ní ọjọ́ karùndínlógún oṣù kẹjọ ọdún 1940, Àwọn tó jẹ́ ọ̀rẹ́ wọnú ìlú southern France, wọ́n sí pé ìkọlù náà ní “Operation Dragon”.
column3: Ní ọjọ́ kẹtàlá oṣù kẹrin ọdún 1940, àwọn ọmọ ogun ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà àti ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì gba ilẹ̀ Fránsì ní ìhà ìwọ̀-oòrùn, ìkọlù náà ni wọ́n ń pè ní "Àtẹ̀jáde Dragoon".

column1: English: One of the panes finally broke, and they started to get out by the window," said survivor Franciszek Kowal. = Yoruba: Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn gíláàsì fèrèsé padà fọ́, wọ́n sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń gba ojù fèrèsé náà jáde,” Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn tó yè Franciszek Kowal ló sọ bẹ́ẹ̀. ### English: Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ sáyẹ̀nsì ti se àfihàn báyìí wípé ọrọ̀ ajé kábọ̀nù tí mún àyípadà bá ibùgbé láti ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ìpínlè rẹ̀ tó dúróo re èyí tó ti ń sàtìlẹyìn fún ìdàgbàsókè ọmọnìyàn láti bí i mílíọ̀nù méjì ọdún sẹ́yìn.
column3: Ìwádìí lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ fi hàn pé ètò ìṣúná owó tí ó ní ìwọ̀n tí ó pọ̀ jùlọ yìí ti mú kí biosphere yí padà kúrò nínú ìṣètò tí ó ti jẹ́ pé ó ti jẹ́ kí ìṣẹ̀dá ènìyàn ó lè wà fún ìgbà díẹ̀ ní àádọ́ta ọdún sẹ́yìn.

column1: English: Wildlife photography is often taken for granted, but like photography in general, a picture is worth a thousand words. = Yoruba: A ma ń fi ọwọ́ yẹpẹrẹ mún àwòrán àwọn ẹranko abẹ̀mí sùgbọ́n bí i àwòrán lápapọ̀, àwòrán kan tó ẹgbẹ̀rún ọ̀rọ̀. ### English: The road where the crash happened was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver from the red Audi TT. = Yoruba:
column2: Wọn ti ọpọpọna ti ijamba naa ti ṣẹlẹ ni titipa fun gba diẹ nigbati awọn oṣiṣẹ pajawiri gbiyanju lati yọ awakọ naa kuro ninu ọkọ Audi TT pupa.
column3: Ìjìyà tí ó wáyé ní ojú ọ̀nà náà ti di títì pa fún ìgbà pípẹ́, bí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ aláàbò ṣe mú afurasí náà kúrò nínú Audi TT tí ó wà ní ìta.

column1: English: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana. = Yoruba: Victoria Falls je ilu ni agbegbe iwo oorun Zimbabwe eyi ti o la enu ibode lati Livingstone, Zambia koja eyi ti o sunmo Botswana. ### English: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun. = Yoruba:
column2: Egberun odun seyin, okunrin ti a n pe ni Aristakusu wipe Ona Orun man yi orun ka.
column3: Ogoji odun ni, omo kan ti a n pe ni Aristarchus ni o so pe, Oju-olodumare nikan ni o n se oko si oju-omi.

column1: English: Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. = Yoruba: Ẹ̀fúùfù ńlá máa ń wú igi ti gbòǹgbò ti gbòǹgbò, a máá sí páànù ilé, a sì máa gbé ọkọ̀ lọ lójú òfurufú. Ìdá méjì ìjì a máa lò tayọ wákàtí mẹ́ta gbáko. ### English: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity. = Yoruba:
column2: Gbogbo eyan lo le de ipo imo ijinle, nkan soso to n dinna aleba yi ni irora wa ati ilodi si w.
column3: Òkè ní gbogbo wá lè gbàyé òyé. Ìwájú wá ní ìwájú wá, tí a bá ti ń wájú wá, a sì máa ń wájú wá.

column1: English: The famous Greek lawyers, Sakis Kechagioglou and George Nikolakopoulos have been imprisoned in the Athens' jail of Korydallus, as they were found guilty of graft and corruption. = Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ti gbajúgbajà amòfin ilẹ Greek, Sakis Kechagioglou àti George Nikolakopoulos mọ́ àhámọ́ ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n Korydallus ti Athens, níbí wọ́n se ní wọ́n jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn ìwà jẹgúdújẹrá àti àjẹbánu. ### English: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation. = Yoruba:
column2: Báwo ni àjọ kan yóò ṣe fẹ́ láti lá irúfẹ́ ìpèníjà ìdásílẹ̀ àjọ fún ìkọ́ni kọjá? Ìpinnu kan tí o lè mú kí èyí ṣe é ṣe ni ìmú ohun titun wá.
column3: Kí ló mú kí ètò kan fẹ́ lọ gba àkókò tí ó pọ̀ láti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ètò ẹ̀kọ́-ọmọnìyàn? Ààbò ni àkọ́kọ́ nínú ìdí tí àwọn ètò ẹ̀kọ́-ọmọnìyàn fi ń gba àgbékalẹ̀.

column1: English: The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. = Yoruba: Àwòrán tókàn ṣàfihàn atoms tó ń jáde láti photons. Lóòtọ́, ní ojú ayé photons kéré gan jú àwọn tí à ń rí nínu àwòrán. ### English: The speeds of 802.11n are substantially faster than that of its predecessors with a maximum theoretical throughput of 600Mbit/s. = Yoruba:

column3: Àtẹ̀jáde 802.11n ní àwọn ẹ̀rọ tí ó ń gbé ní àyè tó ga ju ti àwọn tó ti kọjá lọ pẹ̀lú àyè tó lè gbé àwo tí ó tó 600Mbit/s.

column1: English: Protesters hope to collect a petition of 1.2 million signatures to present to the National Congress in November. = Yoruba: Àwọn afẹ̀hohnúhàn lérò láti gba ìfọwọ́bọ̀wé tó tó 1.2 miliọnu láti fi ṣọwọ́ sí àpérò orílẹ̀èdè ni oṣu kejìl. ### English: North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s. = Yoruba: Biotilejepe awon omowe kan daba pe nitori pe awon ara besini Odo Sarasfati to ti wa gbe laju, o ye ki won pe ni Olaju Indus-Sarasfati, awon kan maa n pe ni Olaju Harapani, akoko ninu awon ibi ti won wu jade ni 1920s. ### English: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. = Yoruba:

column1: English: In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. = Yoruba: Ní ọdún 1970, dókítà oníṣègùn òyìnbó àti ìwádìí ìmò sáyẹ́nsì, Raymond Damadian, ṣàwárí lílo ohun òǹfà ìgbohún-pẹ̀lú -àwòrán jáde gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀rọ fún àyẹ̀wò àwọn ìwádìí àìsàn. ### English: Buses depart the inter-district bus station (across the river) throughout the day, though most, especially those heading to the east and Jakar/Bumthang leave between 06:30 and 07:30. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana. = Yoruba: Victoria Falls je ilu ni agbegbe iwo oorun Zimbabwe eyi ti o la enu ibode lati Livingstone, Zambia koja eyi ti o sunmo Botswana. ### English: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. column2: Ní ti àlàkalẹ̀, Buddhism ti ilẹ̀ Tibetan rọrùn. Ó ní àṣàrò Kundalini Yoga,àtipa àgbélárugẹ ìfẹ́.
column3: Igbinimo Tibetan Buddhism je ipilese pataki. O je sisoro Kundalini Yoga, meditation ati ipese gbogbo-olodumare.

column1: English: David Headley's scouting and information gathering had helped to enable the operation by the 10 gunmen from the Pakistani militant group Laskhar-e-Taiba. = Yoruba: Ìfimúnlẹ̀ àti ìwadìí David Headley ti se ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún isẹ́ àkànṣe láti ọwọ́ àwọn ikọ̀ agbẹ́bọn mẹwa láti ẹgbẹ́ agbẹ́sùmònmí Pakistani Laskhar-e-Taiba. ### English: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. = Yoruba:
column2: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ìyọpọ̀ tó má ń wáyé nínú ìsègùn eegun àti isesí ló má ń dálé àwọn ìjẹyọ inú ara àti ìpèse látata àwọn aago biọ́lọ́jì.
column3: Àwọn ènìyàn kan ti rí ìṣirò nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àti ìṣe tí ó ṣe pàtàkì jùlọ ní ìmọ̀ràn àwọn ìṣirò endogenous àti bí wọ́n ṣe ń mú wọn wá láti ibi ìṣirò.

column1: English: The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap. = Yoruba: A nílò ìwé ìkọjá Angkoṛ láti wọnú ilé Ìsìn náà torínáà ma gbàgbé láti mú ìwé ìrìn àjò rę to bá n bọ̀ ní Tonle Sap. ### English: In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands. = Yoruba:

column3: Ní ọdún 1990, ó jẹ́ kíkọ sí ìjábọ̀ àwọn ilé ìjọsìn tí ó wà ní ààlà agbègbè tí ó wà ní ìlà-oòrùn, nítorí ewu tí ó wà nínú ààrùn aṣálẹ̀.

column1: English: That means everything has to be put back," said researcher at the Rift Valley Research Service in Ethiopia and a co-author of the study, Berhane Asfaw. = Yoruba: Ó túmọ̀sí wípé ohun gbogbo ní láti padàbọ̀ sípò “olùsàyẹ̀wò ní iléeṣẹ́ Rift Valle nilẹ̀ Ethiopia àti olùkọ̀we ìwáàdí Berhane Asfaw. ### English: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions. = Yoruba:

column1: English: These plateaus are often referred to as "vidde" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. = Yoruba: Wọ́n ma ń pé plateau yìí ní “vidde” ìtumọ̀ ní ọgbà tí kò ní igi, tó sì fẹ̀. ### English: The idea of skiing is very old — cave paintings depicting skiers date back as far as 5000 BC! = Yoruba:
column2: Ọjọ́ ti lọ lórí èrò yíyọ̀ lórí yìnyín — kíkun ihò ilẹ̀ sàfihàn àwọn arin yìnyín tó ti wà láti bí i 5000 BC!
column3: Ìdáni láti máa fi òkò ski ni ó ti wà láti ìgbà tí àwọn ènìyàn ti ń gbé ní ilẹ̀ wa. Àwòrán tí ó wà ní abala yìí ti wà láti ọdún 5000 sẹ́yìn.

column1: English: Coffee is one of the world's most traded commodities, and you can probably find many types in your home region. = Yoruba: Kọfí jẹ́ ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ohun èlò tí wọ́n ń tà lágbàáyé, o sì lè rí i ní ọ̀pọ̀ ẹkùn ilé rẹ. ### English: Even traditionally, though, not all Sámi have been involved in big scale reindeer husbandry, but lived from fishing, hunting and similar, having reindeer mostly as draft animals. = Yoruba:
column2: Kódà nínú ìse pàápàá, kìí se gbogbo Sami ló ti lọ́wọ́ nínú ọ̀sìn aládàńlá ẹranko reindeer, sùgbọ́n wọ́n ń gbé láti pípẹja, ọdẹ síse àti ohun tí ó jọ èyí , níní Reindeer gẹ́gẹ́ bí eranko ìpamọ́.
column3: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé bí ó ti lẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọ̀pọ̀ Sámi kò jẹ́ kí wọ́n máa ń lo àwọn ọ̀dọ́ àgùntàn tí wọ́n ń pè ní rámi láti fi ṣe iṣẹ́ àgbẹ̀, wọ́n máa ń lo àwọn ọ̀dọ́ àgùntàn náà gẹ́gẹ́ bí ohun èlò tí wọ́n ń tà lágbàáyé.

column1: English: Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Lẹ́yìna, ikú Alexander, tẹ́ḿpìlì náà di àtúnkọ ní 323 BCE. ### English: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places. = Yoruba:

column3: Ó ní láti wà fún ọdún 40 tí ó ń bọ̀, ó sì jẹ́ pé ogun náà ni ó máa ń wáyé ní oríṣiríṣi ibi láti Áfríkà sí Àsia, ní Afghanistan, Cuba àti ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ibi mìíràn.

column1: English: You could find yourself being used as a drug carrier without your knowledge, which will land you in a great deal of trouble. = Yoruba: Won le ma lo e fi gbe oogun lai je pe o mo, to ma ja e sinu isoro pupo. ### English: Four skiers in the women's sitting group failed to finish their runs, and 45 of the 117 total skiers in the Giant Slalom failed to rank in the race. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms. = Yoruba: Ósọ̀wọ́n láti rí àwọn ìdílé pẹ̀lú ọmọ, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn iléègbé àwọn akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ máa ń fàyè gbà wọn ní yàrá àdáni. ### English: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups. = Yoruba:
column2: Ní sẹ́ntúrì kẹrìndínlógún, Paraguay tí wọ́n pè ní “Agbègbè Nlá tí Indíaì” ni wọ́n bií látàrí láti ìpàdé àwọn aṣẹ́gun ilẹ̀ Spain pẹ̀lú àwọn ęgbẹ́ ìbílẹ̀.
column3: Nínú ọdún 16, Paraguay, tí ó ti jẹ́ orúkọ rẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀, tí a tún ń pè ní “Ìlú Àgbá Gígùn ilẹ̀ Áfríkà”, jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó ti wá látàrí ìkọlù àwọn ọmọ ogun ilẹ̀ Spéìn pẹ̀lú àwọn abínibí ilẹ̀ náà.

column1: English: The advice assumes that travellers do not steal, trespass, participate in the illegal market, beg, or otherwise exploit other people for their own gain. = Yoruba: Ìmọ̀ràn náà gbèrò wípé àwọn arìnrìn-àjò kò ní jalè, kọjá àyè, kópa nínú ọjà lòdì sí òfin, tọrọ, tàbí lọ́ àwọn ènìyàn mìírànlọ́wọ́ gbà fún tí ara ẹni. ### English: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions. = Yoruba:

column1: English: These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph). = Yoruba: Ìjì líle ti gbì tó okòódínníẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀ta kìlómítà láàrin wákàtí (133 m/s; 300 mph). ### English: Apia was founded in the 1850s and has been the official capital of Samoa since 1959. = Yoruba:
column2: Wọ́n dá ìlú Apia sílẹ̀ ní àwọn ọdún 1850, ó sì ti jẹ̀ olú ìlú Samoa láti ọdún 1959.
column3: Apia ni ilu ti o wa ni Samoan ni ọdun 1850, o si ti di olu ilu Samoan ni ọdun 1959.

column1: English: After it became apparent that many families were seeking legal help to fight the evictions, a meeting was held on March 20 at the East Bay Community Law Center for the victims of the housing scam. = Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tó hàn gbangba pé ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ìdílé ń wá ìrànlọ́wọ́ òfin láti dojúkọ lílé jáde , ìpàdé kàn wáyé ní ogúnjọ́ oṣù kẹta ní ibùdó òfin ni agbègbè ìlà-Òòrùn ìyáwó omi òkun sínú ilé. ### English: The tenth named storm of the Atlantic Hurricane season, Subtropical Storm Jerry, formed in the Atlantic Ocean today. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìjì lílé kẹwàá ti sáà Atlantic Hurricane, Subtropical Storm Jerry, ni wọ́n sẹ̀dà ní ọ̀sà Atlantic lónìí.

column1: English: In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia. = Yoruba: Ní àwọn ọdun aipẹ julọ century 18 náà àwọn eniyan ti Vietnam gbógun ti Cambodia. ### English: During the struggle for independence organised by the Mau movement, a peaceful gathering in the town resulted in the killing of the paramount chief Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III. = Yoruba:

column3: Ní àkókò tí àwọn ènìyàn ń jà fún òmìnira tí Mau ń jà fún, ìjìyà kan wáyé ní ìlú náà, èyí tí ó mú kí Olóyè Túpà Tásẹ̀lé Lẹ́lófì III kú.

column1: English: The man suspected of detonating the bomb was detained, after sustaining injuries from the blast. = Yoruba: Wọ́n ti fi páńpẹ́ òfin gbé ọkùnrin tí wọ́n fura sí pé o ju àdó olóró, lẹ́yìn tí ó ṣèse látàrí ìjàmbá àdó olóró náà. ### English: According to Japan's nuclear agency, radioactive caesium and iodine has been identified at the plant. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Sir Richard Branson's Virgin Group had a bid for the bank rejected prior to the bank’s nationalisation. = Yoruba: Ẹgbẹ́ Virgin ti Sir Richard Branson ní ìdù fún ǹkan ti ilé ìfowópamọ́ ti kọ̀ sílẹ̀ ṣáájú ìyípòpadà ilé ìfowópamọ́. ### English: Turkey would also take over guarding captured ISIS fighters which, the statement said, European nations have refused to repatriate. = Yoruba:
column2: Turkey yíò pẹ̀lú àmójútó ìdábòbò àwọn ọlótè ISIS tí wọ́n mú, èyí tí àlàyé fi síta , àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè Yúróòpù tí kọ̀ jálè láti fi ipá gbé padà sí ìlú wọn.
column3: Turkey yóò tún gba gba àwọn ọmọ ISIS tí wọ́n ti kó níbẹ̀, èyí tí a sọ nínú ìròyìn náà pé àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè Europe ti kọ̀ láti mú padà.

column1: English: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. = Yoruba: Jardin de la Union. A kọ́ ààyè yí gẹ́gẹ́ bíi gbàgede fún ilé ìjọsìn okan ni orundun ketadinlogun, èyí tí tẹ́ḿpìlì de San Diego jẹ́ ilé kan soso tó wà di ìsinsìnyí. ### English: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. = Yoruba:
column2: Ẹkùn náà wà nínu ẹgbk kanáà (Genus Panthera) gẹ́gk bí kìnìú, àmọ̀tékù, àti olóngbò ńlá. Àwọn olọ́ngbò mẹrin wọ̀nyí nìkan ló lè dún.
column3: Ìyá tigre ni ó wà nínú ẹgbẹ́ kan náà (Ìgbẹ́kẹ̀ Panthera) pẹ̀lú àwọn tigre, àwọn jaguar àti àwọn léopard. Àwọn tigre yìí ni ó ní agbára láti ro.

column1: English: Leslie Aun, a spokesperson for the Komen Foundation, said the organization adopted a new rule that does not allow grants or funding to be awarded to organizations that are under legal investigation. = Yoruba: Leslie Aun, tí ó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ àjọ Komen, sọ pé ẹgbẹ́ náà ti ní òfin tuntun tí kò fi ààyè gba fífún àwọn àjọ tí ó wà labẹ́ ìwádìí òfin ní owó-ìfiṣẹ̀rànwọ́-fún tàbí ẹ̀bù. ### English: But the consumer market on laptop computer will be radically varied and changed after ASUS was awarded in the 2007 Taiwan Sustainable Award by Executive Yuan of the Republic of China. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Pittman suggested that conditions wouldn't improve until sometime next week. = Yoruba: Pittman dámọ̀ràn àtúnse ò ní wáyé bí kò di ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀. ### English: Dr. Malar Balasubramanian, 29, was found in Blue Ash, Ohio, a suburb approximately 15 miles north of Cincinnati lying on the ground beside the road in a T-shirt and underwear in an apparently heavily medicated state. = Yoruba:
column2: Dr. Malar Balasubramanian, ẹni ọdún mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ̀n ní wọ́n rí ní Blue Ash, Ohio, agbègbè tó dàbí máìlì márùndínlógún sí àríwá Cincinnati, tó sùn sí ẹ̀gbẹ́ ojú ọ̀nà nínú aṣọ T-shirt àti àwọ̀tẹ́lẹ̀ nípò tó sàfihàn pé ó ń lo òògùn.
column3: Dr. Malar Balasubramanian, 29, jẹ́ tí wọ́n rí ní Blue Ash, Ohio, agbègbè tí ó wà ní ìhà gúúsù ìlú Cincinnati, ó wà lórí ilẹ̀ pẹ̀lú T-shirt àti underwear, ó sì wà ní ìhòòhò pẹ̀lú èròjà alárùn kan.

column1: English: Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage. = Yoruba: Nígbà tí Whirling Dervishes dé sórí ìtàgé. ### English: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. = Yoruba:
column2: Ní ọdún 1683, àwọn ọmọ ogun ìran Qing (1644-1912) gba àkóso agbègbèTaiwan western àti northern coastal wọ́n sì sọ Taiwan dí ìlú ti Qing Empire ní 1885.
column3: Nígbà tí Qing dynasty (1644-1912) bá kó Taiwan ní ọdún 1683, àwọn ọmọ ogun Qing dynasty (1644-1912) gba àwọn agbègbè tí ó wà ní ìhà gúúsù àti ìhà àríwá Taiwan, wọ́n sì fi Taiwan sípò gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìpín kan ní ọdún 1885.

column1: English: The White Sea–Baltic Canal connects the Arctic Ocean to the Baltic Sea, via Lake Onega, Lake Ladoga and Saint Petersburg, mostly by rivers and lakes. = Yoruba: Òkun Funfun - Kànáà Baltiki há mó. Òkun Atiki, láti Odò Onega, Odò Ladoga àti Eyan mimo Pitasboogi, odo nla ati kekere ni púpọ̀ wọn. ### English: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Already reporting in English and Japanese, the global organization is launching Spanish, Italian, and Korean-language programs, for television, the web, and mobile devices. = Yoruba: Wọ́n ti ń jábọ̀ ní èdè gẹ̀ẹ́sì àti Japan, àjọ àgbáyé ti ń sàfilọ́lẹ̀ ìlàna ètò lédè ilẹ̀ Spain, Italy, àti Korea fún ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán, ìtàkù ayélujára àtàwọn ẹ̀rọ ìbáraẹnisọ̀rọ̀. ### English: The ruling party, South West Africa People's Organisation (SWAPO), also retained a majority in the parliamentary elections. = Yoruba:

column1: English: At 11:20, the police asked the protesters to move back on to the pavement, stating that they needed to balance the right to protest with the traffic building up. = Yoruba: Ní aago mọ́kànlá kọjá ogún ìsẹ́jù, iléeṣẹ́ ọlọ́ọ̀pá tí ní káwọn olùsèfẹ̀hónúhàn sún sẹ́yìn, sọ pé wọ́n nílò láti sètò ìfẹ̀hónúhàn pẹ̀lú súnkẹrẹ fàkẹrẹ tó ń kó jọ. ### English: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November. = Yoruba:
column2: Láti ìgbà tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti gba ìsúná ilé ìwòsàn Mersey tí ó wà ní Devonport, ní Tasmania, ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ àti àwọn Aṣojú ìjọbá àpapọ̀ ti bu ẹnu àtẹ́ lu ìgbésẹ̀ yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ètè tí ó ní í ṣe pẹlú ètò ìdìbò tó ń bọ̀ ní oṣù kọkànlá.
column3: Tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ bá ti mú kí ilé ìwòsàn Mersey, tí ó wà ní Devonport, Ìpínlẹ̀ Tásmania, ó di ti ìjọba àpapọ̀, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti àwọn olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà ti ń sọ pé ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà jẹ́ àyẹ̀wò láti mú kí àwọn ènìyàn ó máa fi ògo fún ìjọba àpapọ̀ tí yóò ṣe ètò ìdìbò ní oṣù kínní.

column1: English: In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia. = Yoruba: Ní àwọn ọdun aipẹ julọ century 18 náà àwọn eniyan ti Vietnam gbógun ti Cambodia. ### English: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. = Yoruba:

column3: Ní ìgbà ogun abẹ́lé, àwọn ẹ̀ka mẹ́wàá náà ṣe àkọ́kọ́ ní ìjọba kan tí kò lágbára tí ó wà ní apá kan tí ó ń jẹ́ Congress ní àwọn àkọsílẹ̀ Articles of Confederation.

column1: English: Some of the applications in this category can even translate texts in foreign languages on signs or other objects in the real world when the user points the smartphone towards those objects. = Yoruba: Àwọn ìwé ìfisọwọ́ tí ó wà ni àbẹ́ ìsòrí yìí lè sọ ọrọ̀ tí ó wà jí kíkọ sílẹ̀sí èdè ilẹ̀ òkèrè lórí àmì tàbí àwọn nǹkan mìíràn ni ojú ayé nigbàtí ẹni náà bá kọ ojú ẹrọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ìgbàlóde sí àwọn nǹkan náà. ### English: The hospital has followed protocol for infection control, including separating the patient from others to prevent possible infection of others. = Yoruba:

column1: English: It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. = Yoruba: Wọ́n sọ ọ́ di mímọ̀ pé lọ́dun 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel sèdásílẹ̀ odi láti fi sèrántí ìṣẹ́gun rẹ̀ tako ikọ̀ ológun Tibetan-Mongol. ### English: The broad boulevards, glass-fronted buildings and modern shopping centers are dotted with traditional red-tiled roofs, the 18th century market, and old mosques and churches, although the city has an atmosphere more of Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn boulevard to fe, ile ti o ni jigi ni iwaju ati oja igbalode ni a fi aja oni taili pupa seso won, oja senturi kejìdílógún, ati awon mọ́ṣáláṣí ati ṣọ́ọ̀si, biotilejepe ilu naa ni afefe to ile Yuropi Mediteraniani ju ile Turkeyi ibile lo.
column3: Àpẹẹrẹ àwọn ilé tí ó ní àwo títì, àwọn ilé tí ó ní ojú ògiri òṣùwọ̀n àti àwọn ilé ìtajà tó ní ojú ògiri tí ó ní àwo títì, ilé ìtajà tí ó ti wà láti ọdún 1800, àti àwọn ilé ìjọsìn àti àwọn ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì tí ó ti wà láti ìgbà tí ó ti di ilẹ̀ Turkey, ni ó wà ní Istanbul, ṣùgbọ́n ìlú náà ní àràárọ̀ tí ó mú un dákẹ́ bíi ilẹ̀ Europe, tí ó sì ní àràárọ̀ tí ó mú un dákẹ́ bíi ilẹ̀ Turkey.

column1: English: At 11:20, the police asked the protesters to move back on to the pavement, stating that they needed to balance the right to protest with the traffic building up. = Yoruba: Ní aago mọ́kànlá kọjá ogún ìsẹ́jù, iléeṣẹ́ ọlọ́ọ̀pá tí ní káwọn olùsèfẹ̀hónúhàn sún sẹ́yìn, sọ pé wọ́n nílò láti sètò ìfẹ̀hónúhàn pẹ̀lú súnkẹrẹ fàkẹrẹ tó ń kó jọ. ### English: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn aṣèwádìí láti ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga Princeton ní United States àti Ilé ẹ̀ka gíga Uppsala ní sweden jábọ̀ ìròyìn ẹ̀yà tuntun ní ó wà ní ìran méjì, ṣùgbọ́n ètò yìí ma ń gba àkókò, látàrí dídàgbà láàrín endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza forted, àti ìṣílọ cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
column3: Àwòrán láti ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gíga Princeton ní United States àti Uppsala ní Sweden ti fi hàn pé irú ẹ̀yà tuntun náà ti di ní àádọ́ta ọjọ́, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé èyí ti jẹ́ kí àwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹ́nsì gbàgbọ́ pé irú ẹ̀yà tuntun náà ti di ní àádọ́ta ọdún, nítorí pé ẹ̀yà kọ̀ọ̀kan ti ń bímọ pẹ̀lú ara wọn.

column1: English: 250 years later, Guinness has grown to a global business that turns over 10 billion euros (US$14.7 billion) every year. = Yoruba: Iléeṣẹ́ Guinness ti dàràbà nínú okoòwò àgbáyé lẹ́yìn ọ̀tàlénígba ó dín mẹ́wàá ọdún tí ó sì ti mún bílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá euro (bílíọ̀nù mẹ́rìnlá ó lé ẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀rin mílíọ̀nù dọ́là) lọ́dọdún. ### English: It's worth half an hour to stroll about the intriguing village. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Nadia, born on September 17, 2007, by Cesarean section at a maternity clinic in Aleisk, Russia, weighed in at a massive 17 pounds 1 ounce. = Yoruba: Nadia tí wọ́n bí ní ọjọ́ kẹtàdínlógún oṣù kẹsàn án láti abala iṣẹ́ abẹ nílé ìwòsàn tó wà ní Aleisk, Russia lówọn tó pọ́ùn mẹ́tàdínlógún ní áùnsì kan. ### English: Famous singers across the country presented bhajans, or devotional songs, to Shri Shyam's feet. = Yoruba:
column2: Awon ogbontarigi olorin kakiri orileede sagbekale bhajans abi orin isin si abe ese Shyam.
column3: Àwọn akọrin tó gbajúmọ̀ ní gbogbo orílẹ̀ èdè náà fi orin ẹ̀sìn, tàbí orin ìfẹ́ sí àwọn ẹsẹ̀ Shri Shyam.

column1: English: This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. = Yoruba: Olaf Trygvasson ṣáàjú ọks náà, ará Norway tó ní ọjọ́ ọ̀la láti gba orílẹ̀ èdè rẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ Danish. ### English: Other subjects on the agenda in Bali include saving the world's remaining forests, and sharing technologies to help developing nations grow in less-polluting ways. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn ǹkan tó wà lórí ètò ní Bali ní títọ́jú aginjú tó kùn ní àgbáyé, àti pínpín ìma ẹ̀ró láti ran àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè tó ṣì ń dàgbà dáadáa.
column3: Àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ míràn tí a ó gbé kalẹ̀ ní Bali ni láti mú àwọn àyíká tí ó kù ní àgbáyé àti láti fi àwọn ẹ̀rọ tó lè mú kí àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè tí ó wà ní àìmọ̀kan ó lè dàgbà láì sí ìdàgbàsókè tó ń fa ìdàgbàsókè bá àyíká.

column1: English: If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing. = Yoruba: To ba bẹ Grinlandi wo ni igba otutu (bi o ṣe n sumọ apa ariwa, o n tutu si i) o ṣe dandan fun ẹ lati mu aṣọ otutu to peye wa. ### English: However, they are not thought to have caused any damage to the shuttle. = Yoruba:
column2: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, kò sí ẹ̀ròngbà wípé wọn mú ìdibàjẹ́ bá agbẹ́rù náà.
column3: Bakan naa, wọn ko nii ṣe iran kan si afẹfẹ shuttle.

column1: English: These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. = Yoruba: Àwọn ewé yí jọ igi ọ̀pẹ́ kékeré pẹ̀lú ewé tó gùn jáde tó mú. ### English: Due to the long distance from the continent mammals were unable to make the journey making the giant tortoise the primary grazing animal in the Galapagos. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World. = Yoruba: Láti ìgbà tí wọ́n dáa sílẹ̀ Alubosa ti di ìròyìn ẹlẹ́fẹ́ tó dáju, pẹ̀lú ìtẹ̀jáde, saiti to fa ojú alejò 5,000,000 ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ ní Owara, ipolowo tara eni, ilé iṢẹ́ ìròyìn tò ṢiṢe fún wákàtí 24, Podkasti, àti ìwé ìmọ̀ ayé - Atlasi ti a Ṣẹ̀ tún gbéjáde tí apé ni “Aye wa tí ò ní Làakáyè”. ### English: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. = Yoruba:

column3: Internet ni ìfojúkojú tó ní àwọn apá kan tí ó jọra pẹ̀lú ìfojúkojú àyíká àti ìfojúkojú àìmọ̀.

column1: English: Felicia, once a Category 4 storm on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale, weakened to a tropical depression before dissipating Tuesday. = Yoruba: Felisia, to fi ìgbà kan jẹ ìjì to wà lórí Abala 4 ní Ojú Ìwọ̀n Ìjì Nla ti Saffir-Simpson, rẹlẹ̀ sí ìjì nla ti ọ̀nà òòorùn kí o to papà fónká ní Ọjọ́ Ìségun. ### English: Combined with its relative inaccessibility, "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands. = Yoruba:
column2: Pelu pe o soro die lati de be, “Timbuktu” ti di apere ile alailegbe, jinjin.
column3: Kí o tó di pé ó di ìlú tí kò ṣeé dé, Timbuktu ti di àmetà fún àwọn ìlú tí ó jìnnà.

column2: Àwọn àṣàyàn mín tó dá lóri bayoritimi ma n nílo mimu nkan olomi (pápá jùlọ omi àbi tí tí a n pè ní diuretiki) ki o tó sùn, o ma n mú kí èyàn maa jítọ̀ dandandan.
column3: Àwọn ọ̀nà míràn ni pé kí o máa mu omi tó tóbi (àti pé kí o máa mu omi tí ó tóbi ju omi lọ) kí o tó sùn, kí o sì máa mú kí o máa lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn láti lọ wojú ara rẹ.

column1: English: Australia's former conservative government refused to ratify Kyoto, saying it would damage the economy with its heavy reliance on coal exports, while countries like India and China were not bound by emissions targets. = Yoruba: Ìjọba tí ó nííse pẹ̀lú ìsẹ̀dálẹ̀ ti ilẹ̀ Australia kọ̀ láti fi àṣẹ si Kyoto, sọ pé yíò se àkóbá fún ọrọ̀ ajé pẹ̀lú bí ó se kó gbogbo ara lé kíkó èédú lọ sókè òkun, nígbàtí orílẹ̀èdè bí i India àti China kò se ní ohunkóhun tó de àfojúsùn àgbéjáde èéfín wọn. ### English: Tournament top seeds South Africa started on the right note when they had a comfortable 26 - 00 win against 5th seeded Zambia. = Yoruba:
column2: Orile Ede South Africa tii se akopa ninu idije ti o da julo bere pelu aseyori ti o ga nigba ti won bori awon akegbe won lati orile ede Zambia ti o wa ni ori akaba karun pelu 26 - 00.
column3: Àìsàn tó nííse tí orílẹ̀èdè South Africa bẹ̀rẹ̀ nííse tí wọ́n fi 26 - 00 gba orílẹ̀èdè Zambia.

column1: English: Arias tested positive for a mild case of the virus, Presidential Minister Rodrigo Arias said. = Yoruba: Àbájádẹ àyèwò fihàn pé Arias ti kó aàrùn náà ní íwọn bíntín, Òjísé Ààrẹ Rodrigo Arias fi síta. ### English: During the 1976 selections he advised Carter on foreign policy, then served as National Security Advisor (NSA) from 1977 to 1981, succeeding Henry Kissinger. = Yoruba:
column2: Lákòókò ìsàlẹ́ṣà ọdún 1976, ó gba Carter nímọ̀ràn lórí ilẹ̀ òkèrè, lẹ́yìn èyí ó jẹ́ olùdámọ̀ràn ààbò àpapọ̀ (NSA) láti ọdún 1977 sí 1981, ẹni tó gbapò Henry Kissinger.
column3: Ní ọdún 1976, ó ṣe àyẹ̀wò fún Carter lórí ètò ìṣèlú, ó sì di Ààrẹ Àjọ Ìṣètò Ìlara Àgbáyé (NSA) láti ọdún 1977 sí 1981, ó sì gba ipò Henry Kissinger.

column1: English: News spread in the Red Lake community today as funerals for Jeff Weise and three of the nine victims were held that another student was arrested in connection with the school shootings of March 21. = Yoruba: Ìròyìn tàn ká ní agbègbè Red Lake lónìí pé bí ìsìnkú Jeff Weise àti àwọn mẹta nínú mẹsan tó farakásá wáyé wípé ọwọ́ tẹ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ míràn ní ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìbọn yínyìn ní ilé ìwé ti ọjọ̀ kankọkànlélógún Oṣù Kẹta. ### English: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. = Yoruba:

column1: English: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. = Yoruba: Àmọ́ ní Okudu 1956, a dán àwọn ìlérí Kruṣẹ́fì wò nígbà rogbodiyan ní Polandi m, tí àwọn oṣiṣẹ́ ń takò àìsí oúnjẹ́, ìdínkù owó iṣẹ́, tó dí rogbodiyan gbogbogbò láti takò Komunisimi. ### English: At Thursday's keynote presentation of the Tokyo Game Show, Nintendo president Satoru Iwata unveiled the controller design for the company's new Nintendo Revolution console. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea. = Yoruba: Ní ọarun ọdún sẹ́yìn, àwọn ènìyàn ti kọ́ ilé sí ibi tó lọlẹ́ tí wọ́n tẹ́ dé òké tó súmọ́ òkun. ### English: France is the seventh country in the European Union to suffer this virus; following Austria, Germany, Slovenia, Bulgaria, Greece and Italy. = Yoruba:

column3: France ni orílẹ-èdè keje ti ilẹ̀ Europe ti ko si virus yii; lẹ́yìn Austria, Germany, Slovenia, Bulgaria, Greece àti Italy.

column1: English: Since Pakistani independence from British rule in 1947, the Pakistani President has appointed "Political Agents" to govern FATA, who exercise near-complete autonomous control over the areas. = Yoruba: Láti ìgbà tí Pakistani ti gba òmìnira lọ́wọ́ ìjọba ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ni ọdún 1947, Ààrẹ orílẹ̀̀èdè Pakistani ti yan àwọn “aṣojú-ẹni nínú ìṣèlú” láti darí FATA, tí ó fẹ́rẹ̀ ẹ́ dá gbogbo orílẹ̀ èdè darí. ### English: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites. = Yoruba:
column2: “Ìlọ́wọ́sí ara ẹni “ àti “ìbásepọ̀ tó tèsíwajú” wà lára ìdanimọ̀ fún àwọn abala ìwúrí titun nípasẹ̀ Eighmey ati McCord (1998) nígbà tí wón ṣe ìwádìí ìhà ohun olumulo ojú opòpó wẹ́ẹ̀bù.
column3: “Ìgbẹ̀san” àti “ìṣẹ́jú àáyá” ni wọ́n tún ti rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí àǹfààní tuntun tí wọ́n ti rí nínú ìpolówó ọjà lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára, gẹ́gẹ́ bí Eighmey àti McCord ti ṣe rí i nínú iṣẹ́ wọn.

column1: English: The 100-metre ship was en route to pick up its usual fertiliser cargo and initially officials feared the vessel could spill a load. = Yoruba: Ọkọ̀ ojú omi 100 metre tí padà láti lọ gbé àwọn ajílẹ̀ àwọn òṣìṣk sì bẹ̀rù pé ọkọ̀ náà lè dànù lọ́nà. ### English: This not only confirms that at least some dinosaurs had feathers, a theory already widespread, but provides details fossils generally cannot, such as color and three-dimensional arrangement. = Yoruba:

column3: Èyí kò sóhun tí ó fi hàn pé àwọn dinosaur kan ní ẹyẹ, èyí tí ó ti wà láàrín àwọn onímọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ó tún pèsè ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ tí àwọn fọ́tò tí a kò lè rí, irú bí àwọ̀ àti ìlà tí ó wà ní ìsàlẹ̀.

column1: English: The station maintained its attitude, despite the loss of a gyroscope earlier in the space station mission, until the end of the spacewalk. = Yoruba: Ibùdó náà kò sọ ìwà rẹ nù, pẹ̀lú bí o ṣe sọ gyroscope nù lẹ́ẹ̀kan ní ibùdó, títí di òpin spacewal. ### English: They include the Netherlands, with Anna Jochemsen finishing ninth in the women's standing class in the Super-G yesterday, and Finland with Katja Saarinen finishing tenth in the same event. = Yoruba:
column2: Wọ́n sàfimọ́ àwọn ará ilẹ̀ Netherlands pẹ̀lú Anna Jochemsen tó parí pẹ̀lú ipò kẹsàn án nínú àwọn obìnrin tó ń dúró ní kílàsì super-G lánàá àti Katja Saarinen ti ìlú Finland tó parí pẹ̀lú ipò kẹwàá nínú ètò kanáà.
column3: Wọ́n ní Netherlands, pẹ̀lú Anna Jochemsen tó parí ìlàkàkà ní ẹ̀kẹrin nínú eré Super-G lọ́jọ́bọ̀, àti Finland pẹ̀lú Katja Saarinen tó parí ìlàkàkà ní ẹ̀kẹfà nínú eré náà.

column1: English: Nadal's head to head record against the Canadian is 7–2. = Yoruba: Nadal sàkọọ́lẹ̀ ìforígbárí o ní àmì méje sóódo pẹ̀lú ilẹ̀ Canada. ### English: Pre-modern observatories are usually obsolete today, and remain as museums, or sites of education. = Yoruba:

column1: English: International Horticultural Expositions are specialised events which showcase floral displays, botanical gardens and anything else to do with plants. = Yoruba: Ètò ìjíròrò àgbáyé tàwọn tó ní nǹkan se pẹ̀lú ọ̀gbìn òdòdó jẹ́ èyí tó má ń se àfihàn àwọn orísìírísìí nǹkan mìíràn tó níí se pẹ̀lú ohun ọ̀gbìn. ### English: USA Gymnastics supports the United States Olympic Committee's letter and accepts the absolute need of the Olympic family to promote a safe environment for all of our athletes. = Yoruba:

column1: English: In the past 20 years, the amount of child-friendly options in Uptown Charlotte has grown exponentially. = Yoruba: Ìyé àwọn ibi ìseré àwọn ọmọdé ní Uptown Charlotte lóti pọ̀ si láti bí i ogún ọdún sẹ́yìn. ### English: The earthquake was centered about 20 km (15 miles) north-northeast of Dillon, and about 65 km (40 miles) south of Butte. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The governor also stated, "Today, we learned that some school aged children have been identified as having had contact with the patient." = Yoruba: Gómìnà náà tún sọpé, Lónìí, a gbọ́ pé a ti rí àwọn ọmọ ilé ìwé tó ti farakan aláìsàn náà.” ### English: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Roberts flatly refused to say about when he believes life begins, an important question when considering the ethics of abortion, saying that it would be unethical to comment on the specifics of likely cases. = Yoruba: Roberts kọ jalẹ lati sọ nipa akoko ti o gbagbọ ẹmi bẹrẹ si ni bẹ, ibeere ti o tobi nigba ti eniyan ba n wo ilana oyun sisẹ,wipe yo jẹ eyi ti ko ba ilana iṣe mu lati sọrọ nipa awọn oriṣiriṣi iṣẹlẹ. ### English: Travellers may encounter animal pests that they are not familiar with in their home regions. = Yoruba:

column3: Awọn oniṣowo le koju awọn ẹru ẹmi ti wọn ko mọ nipa wọn ni awọn agbegbe wọn.

column1: English: In London, about 200 people protested outside some major copyright holders' offices. = Yoruba: Nìlú Londoni o tó bìí èyàn 200 tó fìfè éhónú hàn níwájú dìé nínú àwọn ilé isé nla tó n di ètò ìlò mu. ### English: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks). = Yoruba:

column1: English: In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking. = Yoruba: Má a gbádùn àwọn eréje ìfò inú yìnyín tó dára jù nígbà òtútù ní ẹkùn àríwá America, àti wíwa alupùpù lórí àpáta to gbámúsé jù lákòókò ooru. ### English: "We will endeavour to cut carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by a notable margin by 2020 from the 2005 level," Hu said. = Yoruba:
column2: “A ó tiraka láti gé ohun tí ó ń jáde carbon dioxide lóní ìwọ̀n GDP pẹ̀lú àmì tó farahàn bí yíò bá fi di 2020 láti ìpele 2005 gẹ́gẹ́ bí” Hu se sọ.
column3: A ó gbìyànjú láti mú kí àkópọ̀ òjíṣẹ́ tí a fi ń mú òjò tó ń jáde nínú GDP di èyí tó dára jù lọ ní ọdún 2020 látàrí ọdún 2005.

column1: English: Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world. = Yoruba: Ìfihàn àwòrán rẹ lóorèkòorẹ́ nínú orin, ẹrẹ́, lítírẹ́sọ̀ àti àsa olókìkí ti ran Ìlu náà áti sọ ámí rẹ di mímọ̀ ní gbogbo àgbáyẹ́. ### English: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs. = Yoruba:
column2: Mosasaurus je apanirun ti o le ju nigba aye re, ko beru nkankan leyin awon mosasaurs miran.
column3: Mosasaurus ni àkópamọ́ àkọ́kọ́ ní àkókò rẹ̀, ó sì kọ̀ láti bẹ̀rù ohun kan, bí kò ṣe àwọn mosasaurus mìíràn.

column1: English: Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting. = Yoruba: Àwọn akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ lè fi ìbéèrè wọn ṣọwọ́ sáwọn olùdarí nígbàkúgbà kí wọ́n sì retí èsì kíákiá, ju kí wọ́n má a dúró de àkókò ípàdé ojú ko ojú tó ń bọ̀. ### English: Chambers, an agnostic, argues that his lawsuit is "frivolous" and "anybody can sue anybody." = Yoruba:
column2: Chambers tó jẹ́ onígberaga jiyàn pé ẹ̀sùn òhun kò lẹ́sẹ̀ ńlẹ̀ àti pé ẹnikẹ́ni lè gbé ẹni tó bá wùú relé ẹjọ́.
column3: Ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú kan, tí ó jẹ́ agbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́, sọ wípé àyẹ̀wò rẹ̀ jẹ́ “ìwà ìkà” àti “gbogbo ènìyàn le ṣe àyẹ̀wò sí gbogbo ènìyàn.”

column1: English: AU trade and industry commissioner Albert Muchanga announced Benin was to join. = Yoruba: Kọmíṣọ́nà ilé iṣẹ́ àti ìtajà AU Albert Muchanga kéde pé Benin ma darapọ̀. ### English: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The unmanned lunar orbiter Chandrayaan-1 ejected its Moon Impact Probe (MIP), which hurtled across the surface of the Moon at 1.5 kilometres per second (3000 miles per hour), and successfully crash landed near the Moon's south pole. = Yoruba: Ọkọ̀ aládásiṣẹ́ afara jọ òṣùpá ojú òfúrufú Chandrayaan-1 ti yọ irinṣẹ́ iwaàdí inú òṣùpá rẹ̀ oon Impact Probe (MIP) jáde, èyí tí ó sáré kọjá ojú òṣùpá ní ìwọ̀n kìlómítà kan ó lé márùn ún fún ìṣẹ́jú kan (ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta máìlì fún wákàtí kan) èyí tí ó se àseyọrí ìjálulẹ̀ lẹ́bàá ìhà gúùsù òṣùpá. ### English: She came to this conclusion due to the multitude of positive comments and encouragement sent to her by both female and male individuals urging that contraception medication be considered a medical necessity. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. = Yoruba: Robaati Hooki, Olùmọ̀ bayọ́lọ́jì láti ìlú Gẹ̀ẹ́sì, ri skwia kekeke ninu kooki pẹ̀lú ẹ̀rọ mikroskopi. ### English: Rare fauna such as the European brown bear, wolf, eagle, owl, lynx, wild cat and capercaillie can be found there, along with many more common species = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn ẹranko tí kò wọ́pọ̀ bí i ti béárì aláwọ̀ búráwùn, ìkokò, idì, òwìwí, ológìnní ijù àti capercaillie ti ilẹ̀ Europe la lè rí pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹ̀yà ẹranko tó wọ́pọ̀ míràn.
column3: Iwe ti o nikan ni iroko, olugbe, eagle, owl, lynx, kìnnìún, kìnnìún, ati capercaillie le wa ni ibudo naa, ni eyi ti o si wa ni ibudo ti o dara ju.

column1: English: Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. = Yoruba: Awọn ará ilẹ̀ German mú Ọlọ́rún wá súnmọ́ àwọn ẹnìyàn ìbilẹ̀, torí náà wọ́n ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ èdè Estonia. ### English: Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. = Yoruba:
column2: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn kòkòrò ní àǹfàní láti ká ìyẹ́ apá won mọ́ ara.
column3: Àwọn ẹyẹ inú omi ní àǹfààní láti mú ẹ̀wọ̀n wọn lọ sí inú ara wọn.

column1: English: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. = Yoruba: Nkan tí ò dáa nipa lensì soomì nipé agbára rẹ láti dájúle nkan àti oye lensì tó nilò láti rí ìdójúké oyé púpọ̀ o ti pọ̀jù tí lensì primu. ### English: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation. = Yoruba:
column2: Wíìlì ti yí àyé padà ní ọ̀nà púpọ̀. Nkan tó tóbi jùlọ tí wíìlì ṣe fún wa ni pé o mú ìrìn àjò yá àti rọrùn fún wa.
column3: Ògùn ti ó ti mú ayé wa di ohun tí ó dára ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ. Ògùn ti ó ti ṣe pàtàkì jùlọ fún wa ni ó ti mú kí ìrìn wa rọrùn àti pé ó ti mú kí ìrìn wa gùn ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ.

column1: English: Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. = Yoruba: Àkókò tún jẹ́ bi a se ń ṣe àfiwẹ́ iye àkókò (gígùn) àwọn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀. ### English: While one experimental vaccine appears able to reduce Ebola mortality, up until now, no drugs have been clearly demonstrated suitable for treating existing infection. = Yoruba:
column2: Nígbàtí àwárí òògùn kan fojú hàn láti dín ikú èbólà kù, títí di àsìkò yìí, kò tí i sí òògùn kan pàtó tí a sàfihàn pé ó lágbára láti tọ́jú ààrùn tó wà nílẹ̀.
column3: Lẹ́yìn ìgbà tí àkọ́kọ́ àjẹsára kan ti di àyẹ̀wò, ó ti di mímọ̀ pé ó lè mú kí ààrùn Ebola ó dínkù, sùgbọ́n, títí di ìsinsìnyí, kò sí àjẹsára kankan tó ti di mímọ̀ pé ó lè mú kí ààrùn náà dínkù.

column1: English: The vote must still be ratified by the full IOC at it's October meeting in Copenhagen. = Yoruba: Gbogbo ìgbìmọ̀ IOC gbọ́dọ̀ tún buwọ́lu ìbò náà nínú ìpàdé oṣù kẹwàá ní Copenhagen. ### English: If you want some small though rich pastries, try what depending on region are called Berliner, Pfannkuchen or Krapfen. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too. = Yoruba: Àwọn ilé ìtura ma ń tọ́jú àwọn ọ̀dọ́mọdé- àwọn àlejò wọn ló ma ń wà lọ́mọ ogún ọdún- àmọ́ o lè rí àwọn àgbàlagbà arìnrìnàjò náà níbẹ̀ pẹ̀lu. ### English: Courier companies are well paid for delivering things quickly. column1: English: Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. = Yoruba: Agbègbè Turkey pẹ̀lú adágún gba bí i ààyè ọ̀rìn lé lẹ́ẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀rin ó lé mẹ́ta ẹgbẹ̀rún onígun mẹ́rin kìlómítà (300,948 sq mi),nínú èyí tí ọ̀tà lé lẹ́ẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀rin ó dín márùn ún ẹgbẹ̀rún ó lé ọ̀rìn lé lẹ́gbẹ̀ta ó lé mẹ́jọ onígun mẹ́rin kìlómítà (291,773 sq mi) ló wà ní ẹkùn ìwọ̀ oòrùn gúúsù Asia àti ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàlélógún, ọ̀tà lé lẹ́ẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀rin ó lé mẹ́rin onígun mẹ́rin kìlómítà (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. ### English: Regular announcements in the Metro are made only in Catalan, but unplanned disruptions are announced by an automated system in a wide variety of languages including Spanish, English, French, Arabic and Japanese. = Yoruba:

column1: English: It is not known at this time what charges will be laid or what led authorities to the boy but juvenile proceedings have begun in federal court. = Yoruba: A kò mọ̀ ní àkókò yí àwọn àyípadà tí wọ́n ma ṣe àti nkan tó jẹ́kí wọ́n rí ọmọ okùnrin náà gbámú, ṣùgbọ́n ètò ilé ẹjọ́ fún ọ̀dọ́ ti bẹ̀rẹ̀. ### English: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Lodin also said officials decided to cancel the runoff in order to save Afghans the expense and security risk of another election. = Yoruba: Lodin tún sọ pẹ àwọn òsisẹ́ pinu láti fagilé àtúndì ìbò láti le yọ àwọn ará Afghanistan lọ́wọ́ ìnáwó àti ewu ààbò tó lè jẹyọ nípasè ètò ìdìbò mìíràn. ### English: Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices. = Yoruba:
column2: Ilé-ìṣe òjisẹ ajé, ìṣòwò àti ilé ìṣe sọ wípé o ti di mímọ wípé ìjàmbá mẹ́tàdínlógbọn lo ti ṣẹlẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ àwọn èrò náà.
column3: Ilé iṣẹ́ Ìjọba Ìbílẹ̀ Japan (METI) sọ pé wọ́n ti mọ àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ 27 tó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹ̀rọ náà.

column1: English: Nowadays air travel is only rarely booked directly through the airline without first searching and comparing prices. = Yoruba: Ní àsìkò yìí , Ìrìnnà ojú òfúrufù nìkan ní ọ̀nà ìgbàyè sílẹ̀ tààra látara ìrìnà ojú òfúrufú láláì kọ́kọ́ sàwárí tàbí sàfiwé iye. ### English: In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. = Yoruba:

column1: English: People were hitting the panes with chairs, but the windows were unbreakable. = Yoruba: Àwọn ènìyàn bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ni ju àga lu fèrèsé, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn fèrèsé náà kò lè fọ. ### English: You can see the pyramids in the dark and you can see them in silence before the show begins. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos. = Yoruba: Níbàámu pẹ̀lú Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) láàrin ọdún 1492 àti 1498, àwọn aṣẹ́gun ilẹ̀ Spain sekúpa àwọn Taíno tíye wọ́n tó ọgọ́rùn ún ẹgbẹ̀rún. ### English: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn ara Arabù kọ́kọ́ mú ẹ̀sìn ìsláàmi si ilẹ̀wọ́n dẹ̀ gbagbo gidi ni Komoros ati Mayoneeti.
column3: Àwọn ará Aràbí tún mú Islam dé ilẹ̀ náà, ó sì gba ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ní Comoros àti Mayotte.

column1: English: In addition to the crushing ice, extreme weather conditions have been hampering rescue efforts. = Yoruba: Ní àfiikún yínyìn tó fọ́,̣ pẹ̀lú ojú Ọjọ́ tí ò rọgbọ ní ó dínà aájò ìdóòlà. ### English: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent. = Yoruba:

column3: Àwọn àkòrí tí ó nílò ìyànjú gbogbo láti mú kí ó di mímọ̀ kí ó tó di àtúnṣe, àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ náà sì fi ìjọba àpapọ̀ ṣe kẹ̀kẹ́, tí àwọn aṣojú wọn sì máa ń kùnà.

column1: English: People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests. = Yoruba: Àwọn ènìyàn tó ní irú ìrònú yìí ní ọpọlọ, wọ́n sì lè gbé ǹkan sórí, wọ́n lè yànjú ìṣòro wọ́n sì lè ṣiṣẹ́ lórí ìdánwò síẹ́nsì. ### English: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. = Yoruba:
column2: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí à ń pè ní ọ̀làjú wá látí inú èdè ìlú Latin, èyí tó túmọ̀ sí ọ̀làjú ilẹ̀ Latin, civitas túmọ̀ sí ìlú tàbí ìpínlẹp àti pé wọ́n tún fi í se àlàyé bí àwùjọ se tóbi tó.
column3: Àkọlé civilization wá láti èdè Latin civilis, èyí tí ó túmọ̀ sí civil, tí ó sì ní ìjápọ̀ pẹ̀lú civis, tí ó túmọ̀ sí olùgbé, àti civitas, tí ó túmọ̀ sí ìlú tàbí ìjọba ìlú, èyí náà tún jẹ́ kí a mọ bí ìlú náà ṣe tóbi tó.

column1: English: In Berlin, police estimated 6,500 protestors. = Yoruba: Ní Berlin, iléeṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ti ṣí àwọn olùsèfẹ̀inúhàn ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́fà ó lé ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta. ### English: The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there. = Yoruba:
column2: Sootani tún ìlú náà kọ gẹ̀gẹ̀ bi Daru I-Badya, àwọn ọlọ́jà ara Speeni to dá ọjà sílè níbẹ̀, sì fún ún ní orùkọ Kasablanka.
column3: Oba Moroko náà tún ìlú náà ṣe gẹ́gẹ́ bí Daru l-Badya, ó sì pe orúkọ náà ní Casablanca nítori pé àwọn oníṣòwò ará Spéìn ti kọ́ àwọn ilé ìfowópamọ́ síbẹ̀.

column1: English: With Armenian backing, a new republic was created. However, no established nation - not even Armenia - officially recognizes it. = Yoruba: Pẹlú àtìlẹyìn Armenian,wọ́n se ìdásílẹ̀ ilẹ̀ olómìnira. Àmọ́ṣá, kò sí orílẹ̀èdè tí wọ́n dá sílẹ̀ - kódà kì í se ilẹ̀ Armenian - tí àwọn aláṣẹ fọwọ́ sí. ### English: The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent. = Yoruba:

column3: Ìyá àkọ́kọ́ náà jẹ́ ti Belgians. Àti pé, omi tó jẹ́ ti ewé ni ó nira láti rí, ṣùgbọ́n ó dára.

column1: English: Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies and the indoor ice events. = Yoruba: Beijing yíò gbà àlejò ayẹyẹ ìbẹ̀rẹ àti ìkásẹ̀nílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn eré ìdárayá yìnyín nínú ilé. ### English: Although the coastal archipelagos and the biggest lakes are indeed big enough for any yacht, smaller boats or even a kayak offer a different experience. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Karno is a well-known but controversial English tutor who taught under Modern Education and King's Glory who claimed to have 9,000 students at the peak of his career. = Yoruba: Karno jẹ́ gbajúgbajà olùkọ́ èdè òyìnbó, ṣùgbọ́n ó tún jẹ́ aláríyànjiyàn olùkọ́ tó ṣiṣẹ́ lábẹ́ Modern Education and king’s Glory to sọpé àwọn ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́sàn-án akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó ń lékè níbi iṣẹ́ wọn. ### English: If you only go ashore using shipboard excursions you will not need a separate visa (as of 2009). = Yoruba:

column1: English: Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. column1: English: Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. = Yoruba: Àwọn ọks òfurufù tó mań ní ìfúni wọ̀nyí ní Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufhansa fún ọkọ́ òfurufú tó wá láti U.S tàbí Canada àti WestJet. ### English: The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn ènìyàn Guarani ni wọ́n jẹ́ ènìyàn ìbílẹ̀ tó ń gbé ibi tó jẹ́ ìlà oòrùn Paraguay báyìí, wọ́n ń gbé bí i apwọn ọdẹ tí ó tún siṣẹ́ ohun ọ̀gbìn alárojẹ.

column1: English: However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). = Yoruba: Àmọ́ṣá, Charles lọ silé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga fásitì ní Trinity College, Cambridge, níbití ó ti kọ́ nípa ẹ̀dá àti àwùjọ àti ìtàn ẹ̀dà, lẹ́yìn èyí ló tún kọ nípa ìtàn, ó pari pẹ̀lu 2:2 (ipò kejì kékeré). ### English: Please treat the site with all of the dignity, solemnity and respect it deserves. Do not make jokes about the Holocaust or Nazis. = Yoruba:
column2: Jọ̀wọ́ fi tọ̀wọ̀tọ̀wọ̀ ṣe pẹlú ilẹ̀ náà, pẹ̀lẹ́pẹ̀lẹ́, sùúrù àti ọ̀wọ̀. Ẹ má ṣe fi Holocaust tàbí Nazis ṣe yẹ̀yẹ.
column3: Ẹ jọ̀wọ́ ẹ fi gbogbo ẹ̀tọ́, àìmọ̀ àti àánú tí ó yẹ sí i hàn. Ẹ má ṣe fi ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀-ọ̀rọ̀ nípa Holocaust tàbí Nazis hàn.

column1: English: The New Zealand police had trouble using their speed radar guns to see how fast Mr Reid was going because of how low Black Beauty is, and the only time the police managed to clock Mr Reid was when he slowed down to 160km/h. = Yoruba: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ilẹ̀ New Zealand ní ìṣòro lílo ìbọn speed radar wọn láti rí bí Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Reid ṣe ń sáré tó, nítorí bí ẹwà ẹ̀nìyàn dudu ti ri, ẹ̀ẹ̀kan soso tí àwọn ọlọ́pàá yóò rí bí Ọgbẹ́ni Reid ṣe ń sáré sí ni ìgbà tí Ó sinmi díẹ̀, èyi ni ọgọ́ta kìlómíta láàrin wákàtí. ### English: First among its 78 recommendations is that a new diplomatic initiative should be taken before the end of this year to secure Iraq’s borders against hostile interventions and to re-establish diplomatic relations with its neighbors. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The two sides would meet in the major semi final where Noosa ran out winners by 11 points. = Yoruba: Àwọn igun méjèèjì ni yíó pàdé níkẹyìn àsekágbá ní ibi tí Noosa ti jáwé olúborí pẹ̀lú àmì mọ́kànlá. ### English: As light pollution in their heyday was not the kind of problem it is today, they are usually located in cities or at campuses, easier to reach than those built in modern times. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service. = Yoruba: Sirena ni àgọ rénjì ṣoṣo tó ní àye ilé ìtura àti ounje gbígbóná pẹ̀lú ipago. Ipago láìsí ounje títà nìkan ni àwọn ìpàgọ́ La Liona, San Pedrilo ati Los Patos ma n ṣe. ### English: South Shetland Islands, discovered in 1819, are claimed by several nations and have the most bases, with sixteen active in 2020. = Yoruba:
column2: Erekuṣu Guusu Shetland, eyi ti a ṣe awari rẹ ni 1819, ni ọpọlọpọ orilẹ ede sọ wipe awọn ni awọn ni ti wọn si ni ipile ti o pọ ju, pẹlu bi mẹrindinlogun ṣe n ṣiṣẹ ni 2020.
column3: Ibi tí a ti ń gbé ní apá ìwọ̀ oòrùn Shetland, tí a ti rí ní ọdún 1819, jẹ́ ti àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè kan, tí ó sì ní àwọn ilé ìtura tó tó 16 ní ọdún 2020.

column1: English: There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. = Yoruba: Èyà míràn tún wà ní ẹrékùsù Chatham àwon ara´ Maori tí won sèwá láti New Zealand. ### English: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945. = Yoruba:
column2: Lọ́dún 1895, lẹ́yìn ìparun ogun Sino àti Japan (1894-1895), ìjọba Qing buwọ́lu àjùmọgbà àláfíà Shimonoseki, nínú èyí tí ó ti gbé agbára kọja Taiwan fún Japan, èyí tó ń darí erékùsù títí dí odún 1945.
column3: Ní 1895, lẹ́yìn tí ó kógun nínú Ìdíje Sino-Japanese (1894-1895), ìjọba Qing fi Ìlà-oòrùn Taiwan sí Japan, tí ó sì ń ṣàkóso ìlà-oòrùn Taiwan títí di 1945.

column1: English: It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. = Yoruba: Wọ́n sọ ọ́ di mímọ̀ pé lọ́dun 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel sèdásílẹ̀ odi láti fi sèrántí ìṣẹ́gun rẹ̀ tako ikọ̀ ológun Tibetan-Mongol. ### English: Del Potro had the early advantage in the second set, but this too required a tie break after reaching 6-6. = Yoruba:
column2: Del Potro ní àfàní láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ní ìpín kẹjì, sùgbọn èyí náà pèfún yíyanjú ìfagagbága lẹ̀yín ayo mẹ́fà si mẹ́fà.
column3: Del Potro ní àǹfààní láti gba àkọ́kọ́ nínú ìkejì, ṣùgbọ́n èyí náà gba ìtúmọ̀ pẹ́lú ìfẹ́kúfẹ̀ẹ́ tó dé 6-6.

column1: English: Ten years later, he led the Soviet part of the Apollo–Soyuz mission symbolizing that the Space Race was over. = Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ọdún mẹ́wáá ó padà darí apá ikọ̀ Apollo-Soyuz ní àfihàn pé eré ìje Space Race ti pari. ### English: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The unmanned lunar orbiter Chandrayaan-1 ejected its Moon Impact Probe (MIP), which hurtled across the surface of the Moon at 1.5 kilometres per second (3000 miles per hour), and successfully crash landed near the Moon's south pole. = Yoruba: Ọkọ̀ aládásiṣẹ́ afara jọ òṣùpá ojú òfúrufú Chandrayaan-1 ti yọ irinṣẹ́ iwaàdí inú òṣùpá rẹ̀ oon Impact Probe (MIP) jáde, èyí tí ó sáré kọjá ojú òṣùpá ní ìwọ̀n kìlómítà kan ó lé márùn ún fún ìṣẹ́jú kan (ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta máìlì fún wákàtí kan) èyí tí ó se àseyọrí ìjálulẹ̀ lẹ́bàá ìhà gúùsù òṣùpá. ### English: They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. = Yoruba:

column3: Wọn fún afẹ́fẹ́ ní ìfaradà tó pọ̀ ju àwọn ohun èlò tí a fi ń gbé lọ, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n lè ní àbájáde tí kò dára nítorí pé àwọn afẹ́fẹ́ lè mú kí àwọn ènìyàn kóra jọ sínú wọn.

column1: English: Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. = Yoruba: Sanskrit jẹ́ èdè tó ti pẹ́ a sì lè fi wé èdè latin tí wọ́n ma sọ ní Europe. ### English: Late on Sunday, the United States President Donald Trump, in a statement delivered via the press secretary, announced US troops would be leaving Syria. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. = Yoruba: Àyè fún àwọn agbègbè olókìkí, bi ilè àgọ Brighy Angel ní ìkángun sí oko ẹran ọ̀sìn Phantom, lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà màa ń jẹ́ gbígbà tan nípa ìpè làti yọ̀nda tí o di gbígbà ní Ọjọ́ àkọ́kọ́ wọn si fàyẹ̀ gba mímú àyè sílẹ̀ síwáájú. ### English: The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. = Yoruba: Àléébù mìíràn tí lẹ́ǹsì àwosúnsún nipé bi ihò bà ṣe tóbi sí (bí o ṣe yára sí ) bẹẹni lẹ́ǹsì lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà yíò sì kéré sí . ### English: Earlier the Chinese news agency Xinhua reported a plane to be hijacked. = Yoruba:

column3: Kí ó tó di pé ilé-iṣẹ́ ìròyìn China Xinhua sọ pé ọkọ̀ òfurufú kan ti jẹ́ kó lọ, ó ti di wí pé ó ti di àádọ́ta ènìyàn tí wọ́n ti kó lọ.

column1: English: Do not sleep on a mattress or pad on the ground in areas where you do not know the local fauna. = Yoruba: Mase sun lori ibusun abi lori aso ta te si ilele ni awon agbegbe ti o komo iru eranko to n gbe nibe abi itan ibe lasiko naa. ### English: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008. = Yoruba:
column2: Nínú àwọn ènìyàn egbèje tí wọ́n rí saájú ètò ìdìbò àpapọ̀ ọdún 2010, àwọn tí ó takoìdi orílẹ̀ olómìnira ilẹ̀ Australia láti ọdún 2008 fi ìdá mẹ́jọ pọ̀ si.
column3: Ojo kan ninu 1,400 eniyan ti o ni ipinu lati se ipolongo fun ile-ise republic ni Australia ni odun 2010, awon ti won ko ni ipinu lati se ipolongo naa ni o ti di 8 ninu 10 lati odun 2008.

column3: Olori ile-ise ile-ise Medecines Sans Frontiere Richard Veerman ni wipe: "Angola je ki o tobi si iwo-iwon ti o kere julọ ti o ti n waye ni Angola," o ni.

column1: English: It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children". = Yoruba: Kìn ṣe àìkè kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́, bí kò ṣe ṣìṣe ségeṣège ní ẹ̀kọ́ kíkọ́, ó ma ń nípa lórí 3-5 percent gbogbo àwọn ọmọdé, kódà mílíọ́nù méjì àwọn ọmọ kékèké ìlú Amékíkà. ### English: The harbor was the site of an infamous naval standoff in 1889 when seven ships from Germany, the US, and Britain refused to leave the harbor. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Northern Rock had required support due to its exposure during the subprime mortgage crisis in 2007. = Yoruba: Northen Rock ti béèrè fún àtìlẹyìn látàrí ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú àjálù ẹ̀yáwo aláìleèsanpadà ní ọdún 2007. ### English: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn agbègbè tó tóbí nínu àríwá ní àwọn ènìyàn tó pọ̀ tí àwọn kan sí wà ní inú igbó tí kò ṣe gbé inú rẹ́.
column3: Àwon agbègbè gúúsù náà ni ó kún fún àwọn ènìyàn tó kéré jùlọ, ó sì wà ní agbègbè tí kò sí ènìyàn kankan.

column1: English: Komen's policy disqualified Planned Parenthood due to a pending investigation on how Planned Parenthood spends and reports its money that is being conducted by Representative Cliff Stearns. = Yoruba: Ìlànà Komen yọ Ètò Òbí kúrò látàrí ìwádìí tọ́ ń lọ lọ́wọ́ bí Ètò Òbí ṣe náwó àti bí wọ́n ṣe jábọ̀ owó nípasẹ̀ Àṣójú Cliff Stearns. ### English: There are also a few buses going north to Hebron, the traditional burial place of the Biblical patriarchs Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and their wives. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn ọkọ́ akérò díẹ̀ tó ń lọ sí àríwá sí Hebron, ìsìnkú náà wáyé ní Biblical patriarch Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, àti àwọn ìyàwó wọn.
column3: Àwọn kan wà tí wọ́n ń lọ sí Hebron, ibi tí àwọn baba ńlá ìgbàanì tí wọ́n jẹ́ Abraham, Isaac, Jacob àti àwọn ìyàwó wọn ti kú.

column1: English: At 1:15 a.m. Saturday, according to witnesses, the bus was going through a green light when the car made a turn in front of it. = Yoruba: Ni aago kàn kojá ìséjú márùndínlógún gégé bi ẹlẹri, ọkò akérò náà lọ níbi iná aláwọ ewé, nígbàtí ọkọ̀ ayọ́kélẹ´ náà yíwọ́ níwájú rẹ̀. ### English: The show originally featured amateur voice actors, local to East Texas. = Yoruba:
column2: Ni atileba ere naa lo awon elere ohun to n kose, to wa ni agbegbe Tegsasi Ila Oru.

column1: English: This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements. = Yoruba: Iléeṣẹ́ tó ń rí sọ́rọ̀ ilẹ̀ okèrè ilẹ̀ Ecuadorian, kí wọ́n sì tẹ̀lé àwọn àlàkalẹ̀ kọ̀ọ̀kan. ### English: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans. = Yoruba:
column2: Nígbàtí ó bá jẹ́ ẹrànko tí kìí ṣe ènìyàn lo tọ́ ọ, ọmọ-Feral a máa hu irúfẹ́ àwọn ìwà kan (tí ó jẹ́ mọ ìrínisí)ó fẹ́rẹ̀ jẹ́ pé bí gbogbo ìwà tí àwọn ẹranko náà ń hu ló ń hù, bí í bíbèrù ènìyàn tàbí kí wọ́n má bìkítà ènìyà.
column3: Kí ó tó di ọmọ tí kò jẹ́ ọmọ ènìyàn, ọmọ tí ó ti jẹ́ ọmọ ẹranko ní ó máa ń ní àwọn ìwà kan (fún àpẹẹrẹ, ó máa ń ní ìbálòpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ẹranko) tí ó máa ń mú kí ó dà bí ẹranko náà, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ó máa ń ní àwọn ààlà kan tí ó máa ń mú kí ó dà bí ọmọ ènìyàn.

column1: English: What is a cell? The word cell comes from the Latin word "cella", meaning "small room", and it was first coined by a microscopist observing the structure of cork. = Yoruba: Kínni sẹ́ẹ̀lì? ọ̀rọ̀ náà wá látinú ọ̀rọ̀ Latin tí wọ́n pè ní “cella”, ìtumọ̀ “iyàrá kékerá” tí wọ́n sì mún un jáde látinu àyẹ̀wò àwọn kòkòrò kékeré àti ètò ìdẹ́nu. ### English: Boating is a national pastime in Finland, with a boat to every seven or eight people. = Yoruba:
column2: Wíwọ ọkọ̀-ojú omi jẹ ìsẹẹsí àsèyìnwá ní Orílè-èdè Finland, pèlú ọkọ̀-ojú omi kan si ènìyàn mẹjẹ tàbí mẹjọ.
column3: Òrìsà ni ó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn ohun tí ó gbajúmọ̀ ní Finland, pẹ̀lú ọkọ̀ kan sí ọ̀kẹ́ àádọ́ta ènìyàn.

column1: English: Since moving to the Catalan-capital, Vidal had played 49 games for the club. = Yoruba: Lati igba ti o ti re koja si olu-ilu Catalan, Vidal ti ko pa ninu idije mokandinlaadota fun egbe agbabolu re. ### English: Also, make sure to pronounce r and rr differently: caro means dear, whereas carro means chariot. = Yoruba:

column1: English: One of the most prominent apps in this category is Google Translate, which allows offline translation after downloading the desired language data. = Yoruba: Ọkàn lára àwọn ohun èlò pàtàkì áàpù yí ni atúmọ̀ èdè Google tó fi aàyè gba Ìtùmò láìsí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára lẹ́yìn tí a ti se igbàsílè ẹ̀dà èdè tó wuni. ### English: Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign. = Yoruba:
column2: Aladari ijoba fi’di he Julia Gillard so nigba ipolongo eto idibo ijoba apapo odun 2010 wipe oun gbagbo pe Autralia yio ni ominira ni opin isejoba Oba’binrin Elizabeth II.
column3: Ààrẹ Àgbà Ìjọba Àpapọ̀ Julia Gillard sọ pé ó ní kí Australia di aláìmòye lẹ́yìn ìgbà tí Ààrẹ Àpapọ̀ Queen Elizabeth II bá ti parí ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ rẹ̀.

column1: English: Tropical Storm Danielle, fourth named storm of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season, has formed in the eastern Atlantic Ocean. = Yoruba: Tropical Storm Danielle, orúkọ ìjì kẹrin ti ọdún 2010 àkókò ìjì líle Atlantic, ti kórajọ ní ìla oòrùn Atlantic Ocean. ### English: Cochamó Valley - Chile's premier climbing destination, known as the Yosemite of South America, with a variety of granite big walls and crags. = Yoruba:

column1: English: To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. = Yoruba: Láti padà sí ipò agbára titélè, wọn gbọdọ̀ mú ìfikún agbára èyí tí wọn gba láti ara ìmólẹ̀ kúrò. ### English: Bush spokesman Gordon Johndroe called North Korea's pledge "a major step towards the goal of achieving the verifiable denuclearization of the Korean peninsula." = Yoruba:
column2: Ẹni tó sọ̀rọ̀ fún Búsì Godoni Johanudro pé ilérí Koria Ariwa ní “ìgbésẹ̀ nlá sọ́na àlébá láti yọ irin ogún nukilia kúrò ní irekusu Koria.
column3: Olùdarí ètò ìpolongo ìjínigbé ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà Gordon Johndroe pè é ní “àkọ́kọ́ búrurú nínú ìgbésẹ̀ láti mú kí ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà ní àkọsílẹ̀ àìmọ̀kan ní ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà.”

column1: English: his second goal of the night was his 60th of the season, becoming the first player to score 60 or more goals in a season since 1995-96, when Jaromir Jagr and Mario Lemieux each reached that milestone. = Yoruba: àmì ayo rẹ̀ kejì ní alé nàà ní ọgọ́ta rẹ ní abala yẹn,tó jẹ́ òṣèrè àkọ́kọ́ ;tó ma gba ọgọ́ta tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ ní abala náà láti 1995-96,nígbàtí Jagr àti Mario Lemieux dé ìpèle tó ní àmì. ### English: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team. = Yoruba:

column1: English: It can usually be replenished fairly easily if you run out, and gives resolution roughly comparable to a current DSLR. = Yoruba: O rọrùn láti dápadà lọ́pọ ìgbà nígbàti´ o ba lọ tan, o si tún fi ìmọ́lè to fé figagbága pèlú lensi oníyíyí olójú kan òdẹ òní. ### English: Summits include breath-taking views from peaks. Climbers from all parts of the world are continually establishing new routes amongst its endless potential of walls. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn òkè téńté pèlú àwọn ìwòye tó wúni lòrì láti àwọn igun tó ga lókẹ̀. Àwọn agùnkè láti gbogbo àgbáyé ń fi gbogbo ìgbà wá ọ̀nà titun láára àwọn ògìri.
column3: Iye àwọn òkè náà ní àwòkọ́ṣe àwòkọ́ṣe láti lè rí ojúu títì láti òkè. Àwọn oníṣègùn orí òkè láti gbogbo agbègbè àgbáyé ń tẹ àwọn ọ̀nà tuntun káàkiri inú àwọn òkè náà.

column1: English: When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk. = Yoruba: Nígbàtí àwọn ènìyàn kò bá rí èkúté bí ohun tó léwu, wọ́n lè sún mọ́ ọn jù léyìí tó sì le fa ewu fún wọn. ### English: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. = Yoruba:
column2: Sùgbọ́n ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ nǹkan lówà nípa ẹyẹ tí ó sì dàbí ti dinosaur.
column3: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn ẹyẹ kan wà tí wọ́n ṣì ń dà bí ẹyẹ dinosaur, ó tó ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ohun tí ó ṣì ń fa àyípadà nínú wọn.

column1: English: A tornado is a spinning column of very low-pressure air, which sucks the surrounding air inward and upward. = Yoruba: Ìjì líle jẹ́ afẹ́fẹ́ tó kórajọ láti kékeré, gbá àwọn atẹ́gùn àyíká rẹ̀ nínú àti lóde pọ̀ mọ́ra. ### English: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. = Yoruba:
column2: Erunrun naa ki tó 70 km lápá tó súmó àti 100km lápá tó jìnà.
column3: Ìlà tí ó wà ní ìhà ọ̀tún jẹ́ 70 km, tí ó wà ní ìhà òsì jẹ́ 100 km.

column1: English: Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. = Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni, ògbóǹragìrì onídajì máìlì, ọkùnrin tó lè na ìṣẹ́jú méjì, ó gbọ́dọ̀ ní iye ìrìn tó tó lẹ́sẹ̀, àmọ́ ìfàyàrán gbọ́dọ̀ wà ní fún gbogbo ewu. ### English: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe. = Yoruba:
column2: Tí Allies bá kùnà, Ìlú Germany lè borí Britain bí ó ṣe borí àwọn tókù ní Europe.
column3: Kí àwọn Alájọṣepọ̀ má ṣe jábọ̀, Gẹ̀ẹ́sì lè jẹ́ kí Gẹ̀ẹ́sì gba ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti gba ilẹ̀ Europe.

column1: English: The hearing also marks the date for the suspect’s right to a speedy trial. = Yoruba: Ìgbẹ́jọ́ náa sàmí ẹ̀tọ́ afurasí sí ṣíṣe ęjọ́ ní kíá kíá. ### English: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. = Yoruba:
column2: Bákan náà, láàárin àkókò ilẹ̀ ọba kan, ọjọ́ orí tí kìí dúró llójú kan, tí ó pín ìgbèríko.Eyí tí a mọ̀ ju nínú irúfẹ́ àkokò yìí ni ìbẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ ìjọba mẹ́ta tí ó wáyé fún ọgọ́ta ọdún láàárin ogún ọba Han àti Ji.
column3: Tí ó bá ti di ìjọba kan sí òmíràn, ó máa ń wà ní àkókò tí ìjọba kan ò bá ti wà fún ìgbà pípẹ́. Ìgbà tí ó gbajúmọ̀ jùlọ nínú àwọn àkókò yìí ni ìgbà tí ó wà fún ọdún 60 tí ó wà láàárín ìjọba Han àti Jin.

column1: English: These aren't very nimble so the trail has to take a long swerve around the Transantarctic Mountains to come onto the plateau. = Yoruba: Oju opo yi ko jafafa to, itopa naa ni lati dojuko ibomiran ni agbegbe ori oke Transantarctic lati wa si petele. ### English: Fluke wrote that the efforts by some to drown out women from speaking out about women’s health were unsuccessful. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Avalanches are not an abnormality; steep slopes can hold only so much slow, and the excess volumes will come down as avalanches. = Yoruba: Iji yinyin kii se ohun ajeji, oke to ga o le di yinyin pupo ju, eyi to ba koja afara lo ma n wa sile gege bii iji yinyi. ### English: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. = Yoruba:
column2: Hershey àti Chase lokòkòrò tàbi àtirú kòkòrò míràn, láti fi ìdí DNA wọn múlẹ̀̀ sínu bacterium.

column1: English: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. = Yoruba: Èfúùfù líle kọlu àwọn agbègbè kékeré yàtọ̀ sí àwọn ìjì líle mìíràn, sùgbọ́n wọ́n lè ba gbogbo nǹkan tó wà lójú ọ̀nà wọn jẹ́. ### English: Bishkek was described as sinking into a state of "anarchy" by one observer, as gangs of people roamed the streets and plundered stores of consumer goods. = Yoruba:
column2: Wọn ṣàpèjúwé Bishkek gẹ́gẹ́ bí èyí tó ti wọ inú ipò tí “gbogbo rẹ́ ti dàrú nígbàtí kò sí olórí” nípa olùwòran kan, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn tí rìn káàkiri ojú títì tí wọ́n sí jí àwọn ọjà àwọn ènìyàn.
column3: Bishkek jẹ́ kí àwọn olùgbé ibẹ̀ kọlu ara wọn gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùgbé ibẹ̀ kan ti sọ, àwọn ènìyàn kan ń rìn káàkiri ìlú náà, wọ́n ń gba àwọn ohun tí wọ́n bá lè gba.

column1: English: Access to these services is often through a toll-free telephone number that can be called from most phones without charge. = Yoruba: Wíwọle sí àwọn isé yíì lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà màà n jẹ́ nípasè ẹ̀rọ fóònù ọ̀fẹ́ tí o lẹ pè láti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ foonu láìsí ìdíyẹlẹ́´. ### English: However, this does not come cheap: as rough rules of thumb, you can expect to pay up to four times the normal economy fare for business, and eleven times for first class! = Yoruba:

column1: English: As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. column3: Bí i òṣùpá ṣe ń mú kí ilẹ̀ máa yára, tí ó sì ń mú kí omi máa yára, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni Milky Way ń mú kí Sagittarius máa yára.

column1: English: Latvia and Slovakia have both delayed the process of joining ACTA. = Yoruba: Latvia àti Slovakia ti mún ìdádúró bá ìlànà àti darapọ̀ mọ́ ACTA. ### English: The bill requires violent video games sold in the state of California to be labeled with a decal reading "18" and makes their sale to a minor punishable by a fine of $1000 per offense. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. = Yoruba: Ìsáré ní ààrín méjí jé eré ìdárayá tí kò wọ́n jú, síbẹ́ àwọn èrò tí kò jẹ òótọ́ tó jẹma àwọn irinṣẹ́ díẹ̀ tí o nílò láti kópa. ### English: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. = Yoruba:
