column2: Lẹ́yìn tí àbájáde wolé, Girinigiṣi sa Santorumu ṣùgbọ́n ìbáwí ló ní fún Romini, tí wọ́n torí ti ẹ ṣe Ìpolówó burúkú fún Gingiriṣi ní ìpínlẹ̀ Iowa.
column3: Nígbà tí àwọn àyẹ̀wò náà dé, Gingrich fi Santorum ṣe àwòkọ́ṣe, ṣùgbọ́n ó fi Romney ṣe àwòkọ́ṣe, ẹni tí ó fi àwọn àgbéjáde àyẹ̀wò tí kò dára hàn lórí Gingrich.

column1: English: On Wednesday, the United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) suspended its professional basketball season due to concerns regarding COVID-19. = Yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ Ọjọ́rú, Ẹgbẹ́ United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) fi ìdádúró sí sáà gbígbá bọ́ọ̀lù àfọwọ́gbá wọn látàrí ààrùn kògbóògun COVID-19. ### English: Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. column3: Ìlú St. Petersburg ní àwọn ìrù-ó-òde tí ó ní àkókò tí ó wà ní ìlú. Ìrù-ó-òde ní àǹfààní láti gba ìwé ẹ̀rí ẹ̀rí (ìjánu) láti gba ìwé ẹ̀rí ẹ̀rí (ìjánu).

column1: English: The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap. = Yoruba: A nílò ìwé ìkọjá Angkoṛ láti wọnú ilé Ìsìn náà torínáà ma gbàgbé láti mú ìwé ìrìn àjò rę to bá n bọ̀ ní Tonle Sap. ### English: Last month Iran saw its worst air disaster in years when an airliner heading to Armenia crashed, killing the 168 on board. = Yoruba:

column3: Oṣù Kẹfà ni Iran rí ìjìyà àìmọye ọdún tí ó jùlọ nínú ìtàn nígbà tí ìjìyà ọkọ̀ òfurufú tó ń lọ sí Arménia ṣubú, ó sì pa àwọn ènìyàn tó tó 168.

column1: English: Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE. = Yoruba: Alexander, gẹ́gẹ bi ọba pinu láti sanwó fún àtúnkọ́ tẹ́ḿpìlì náà sùgbọ́n a kò gba ìpinu rẹ láàyè. column1: English: Wild animals might either be shy or aggressive. The environment might be cold, hot, or otherwise hostile. = Yoruba: Àwọn eranko búburú lè jẹ́ onítìjú tàbí kí wọ́n burú. column1: English: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified. = Yoruba: Níwọn ìgbà tí aje San Francisco sopọ mọ bó ṣe jẹ́ ibi ti gbogbo arìnrìnajo àgbáyẹ nífẹsí, ajẹ́ rẹ jẹ́ oníruurú. ### English: Many of the traditions surrounding the holiday have been adopted also by non-believers in Christian countries and non-Christians around the world. = Yoruba:
column2: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ìṣe tó yí ìsinmi ká ní àwọn tí kìí ṣe onígbàgbọ́ láwọn orílẹ̀èdè àwọn ọmọlẹ́yìn Kristi àti àwọn tí kì í ṣe ọmọlẹ́yìn Kristi lágbàáyé.
column3: Àwọn ẹ̀sìn àti àṣà tó wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìrékọjá náà ti di ohun tí gbogbo ènìyàn ń ṣe ní gbogbo àgbáyé.

column1: English: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too. = Yoruba: Àwọn ilé ìtura ma ń tọ́jú àwọn ọ̀dọ́mọdé- àwọn àlejò wọn ló ma ń wà lọ́mọ ogún ọdún- àmọ́ o lè rí àwọn àgbàlagbà arìnrìnàjò náà níbẹ̀ pẹ̀lu. ### English: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond. = Yoruba:
column2: Ní jìnnà jìnnà gúúsù ni Niagra Falls àti ní àríwá ni ilé sáwọn ẹwà àtọrun wá fún Muskoka àti rékọjá rẹ̀.
column3: Ní gúúsù ni Niagara Falls, ní àríwá ni ilé ìtura náà wà, ó sì tún ní àwọn àyíká tí ó ń mú kí àyíká rẹ̀ ó di mímọ́.

column1: English: General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. = Yoruba: Ọ̀gágun James Ewing yóò kó ọmọ ológun ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀rin fo oi tó wà ní Trenton Ferry, gba afárá lórí Odọ̀ Assunpinki, gbégi rénà ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ kí wọ́n má lè sá. ### English: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The proposed amendment already passed both houses in 2011. = Yoruba: Àbá àtúnse tigbawájú ilé méjéèjì kọjá lọ́dún 2011. ### English: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. = Yoruba: Àwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹ́nsì ma n pè ní “stimulated emission of radiation” torí àwọn átọ́mù ma ń fura sí iná tó ràn èyí ṣokùn fa kí fotoni ina maa jáde,iná dẹ̀ jẹ́ irúfẹ́ redieṣọ́ni. ### English: Argentina is well known for having one of the best polo teams and players in the world. = Yoruba:
column2: A mọ ìlú Argentina nitorí wọ́n ní ẹgbẹ́ polo àti òṣèrè ní àgbáyé.
column3: Argentina ni orísun tí ó ti wá ní àwọn akọni àti akọni tó dára jù lọ nínú eré poló.

column1: English: A few weeks ago, after the information published by the journalist Makis Triantafylopoulos in his popular Television show "Zoungla" in Alpha TV, the member of Parliament and lawyer, Petros Mantouvalos was abdicated as members of his office had been involved in illegal graft and corruption. = Yoruba: Ní ọ̀sẹ̀ díè sẹ́yìn, lẹyìn ìròyìn tí akọròyìn Makis Triantafylopoulos sẹ àtèjádẹ rẹ nínú gbajúgbajà àfihàn tẹlifísàn “Zoungla” ní Alpha TV, ọmọ ẹgbé ilẹ́ ìgbimọ̀ asòfin àti agbẹjórò, Petros Mantouvalos gba ìdáláre bi àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ míràn nínú ofiisi rẹ se lọ́wọ́ nínú ìwà ìbàjẹ́ àti ìlòdì sófin. ### English: He has been unable to take the drugs needed to overcome his pain as they are banned from the Games. = Yoruba:
column2: Kò tí ì le lo àwọn òògùn tó nílò láti borí ìnira rẹ̀ níbí wọ́n se ti fòfin dèwọ́n nínú ìdíje.
column3: Ó ti ko àwọn oògùn tí ó nílò láti mú kí ó borí ìrora rẹ̀ nítorí pé wọ́n ti jẹ́ dídálẹ́kun nínú ìdíje náà.

column1: English: 21-year-old Jesus joined Manchester City last year in January 2017 from Brazilian club Palmeiras for a reported fee of £27 million. = Yoruba: Jesu omo odun mokanlelogun darapo mo egbe agbabolu Manchester City lodun ti o koja ni osu kinni odun 2017 lati egbe agbabolu Palmeiras ni orile ede Brazil fun owo ti o to £27 million. ### English: They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa). = Yoruba:

column1: English: Imagine, if you will, a Mancunian, Bostonian, Jamaican and Sydneysider sitting around a table having dinner at a restaurant in Toronto. = Yoruba: Ìwọ kàn rò ó, tí ìwọ tí o jẹ́ Mancunian, Bostonian, Jamaican àti Sydneysider jókòó sí orí tábílì láti jẹun alẹ́ ni ilé ońjẹ ni Toront. ### English: Fruit pastries are common, with apples cooked into pastries year round, and cherries and plums making their appearances during the summer. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Maroochydore had finished on top of the ladder, six points clear of Noosa in second. = Yoruba: Maroochydore ti parí lórí òkè téńté àkàsọ̀, àmì ayò mẹ́fà ni ó fi la Noosa tí o wà ni ipò kejì. ### English: A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìdá ogún omi tó dà sílẹ̀ nínú àwọn odò ayé sínú òkun wá láti Amazon.
column3: Kòkòrò tí ó tó 20% tí ó ń jáde láti odò tí ó ń lọ sí òkun ni ó ń jáde láti odò Amazon.

column1: English: The JAS 39C Gripen crashed onto a runway at around 9:30 am local time (0230 UTC) and exploded, closing the airport to commercial flights. = Yoruba: Jas 39C lọ kọlu ibi tí ènìyàn ma ń gbà ní ago mẹsán àbọ̀ (0230 UTC) ó sì jọ́nà, tó sì ti àwọn ọkọ̀ òfuruf;u pa. ### English: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events. = Yoruba:
column2: Èré ìdárayá ìgbà òtútù ní wọ́n sábàá ma ń se ní ẹkùn àríwá pẹ̀lú àwọn ará ilẹ̀ Italy tó ma ń figagbága nínú ìdíje àgbáyé àti ètò Olympi.
column3: Ìdílé tí ó ń gbé ní ìlà Oòrùn ni ó ń gba ẹ̀bùn jùlọ nínú eré orí ìtàgé àti eré orí ẹ̀rọ amóhù-máwòrán.

column1: English: The fabulous riches of the tomb are no longer in it, but have been removed to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo. = Yoruba: Ọrọ̀ ńlá inú ibojì kò sí níbẹ̀ mọ́, sùgbọ́n wọ́n ti gbe lọ sí ilé ìkó iṣẹ́ ọnà sí ni Cairo, ní ilẹ̀ Egypt. ### English: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn àkọọ́lẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti se jẹ jáde, ni ó ma tọ́ka sí ìfànfà ẹnubodè, léyìí tí ilẹ̀ Palestine fẹ́ níbàámun pẹ̀lú bí ibodè se wà sáájú oogun Mideast lọ́dún 1967.
column3: Ìwé náà, gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ti gbọ́, yóò sọ nípa ìpolongo tí Palestine fẹ́ láti ṣe lórí ààlà tí ó wà ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ àwọn ọdún 1960 ní ilẹ̀ Mideast.

column1: English: While on his warm-up lap, Lenz fell off his bike, and was then struck by fellow racer Xavier Zayat. = Yoruba: Ní àkókò tí ó ń gbáradì, Lenz subu lórí alùpùpù rẹ̀, akẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀, Xavier Zayat sì rọ́ọ̀lú. ### English: Though it is widely used, especially among non-Romani, the word "Gypsy" is often considered offensive because of its associations with negative stereotypes and inaccurate perceptions of Romani people. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The PBS show has more than two-dozen Emmy awards, and its run is shorter only than Sesame Street and Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. = Yoruba: Ètò PBS ní tó àmì ẹ̀yẹ Emmy tó lé ní dọ́sìnì méjì, Ó sì ma ń kéré jú òpópónà Sesame àti agbègbè ọ̀gbẹ́ni Rogers lọ. ### English: Scotturb Bus 403 travels regularly to Sintra, stopping at Cabo da Roca. = Yoruba:
column2: Boosi Skotobi 403 ma n rin irin ajo deede lo si Sintra o ma n duro ni Kabo da Roka.
column3: Scotturb Bus 403 ń ń lọ si Sintra, ó sì ń ń dúró ní Cabo da Roca.

column1: English: Fifteen of these rocks are attributed to the meteorite shower last July. = Yoruba: Maarundinlogun lára awon òkúta wọ̀nyí ni òjò mitiyo Agëmọ tó kọjá fà. ### English: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon. = Yoruba:
column2: Nọ́ḿbà bínárì lè ní ọ̀kan nínú iye méjì ìyẹn oódo àti oókan, àwọn iye wọ̀nyìí ni wọ́n ń pè ní binary digits - tàbí bits, láti le fi se jágbajàgba ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá.
column3: Awo-iwure kan le gba iye kan ti o le ni 0 tabi 1, eyi ti a n pe ni awon odo-iwure binari, tabi tabi, lati gba awon onimo-iwure ile-iwe.

column1: English: Nadal bagged 88% net points in the match winning 76 points in the first serve. = Yoruba: Nadal ní àmì ayò 88% ní bọ́ọ̀lù náà tó sì gba àmì ayò 76 ní abala àkọ́kọ́. ### English: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal. = Yoruba:
column2: Kòdánilójú, sùgbọ̀n ó lè ti ní ahọ́n amúga. Lára oúnjẹ rẹ̀ ni ìjàpà, ẹja ńlá, àwọn mosasaurs àti pé ó lè jẹ́ àwọn ẹranko tó ń jẹ́ ènìyàn.
column3: A kò mọ tẹ́lẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n ó lè ti ní ẹsẹ̀ méjì. Ìdíje rẹ̀ ni ẹja, ẹja ńlá, àwọn ẹja míràn, ó lè jẹ́ kí ó jẹ ara rẹ̀.

column1: English: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. = Yoruba: Ní ìbániníbùba ní ìlà-òrùn Bardia, àwọn ara IÌú Gẹ̀ẹ́si mu olórí Amojú-Ẹ̀rọ Ìpín-Kẹ̀wá Italian, General Lastucci. ### English: Several people verified the discovery using different hardware and software by the beginning of February and it was announced on Tuesday. = Yoruba:
column2: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ló sé àfimúnlẹ̀ àwárí lílo orísìírísìí ohun èlò bí yó bá fi di Osù Kejì àti wípé wọ́n kéde rẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ ìṣẹ́gun.
column3: ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ni ó fi ẹ̀rọ-ayélujára àti ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ hàn án ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù kejì, ó sì jẹ́ wí pé ó ti jẹ́ wí pé ó ti wà ní ọjọ́ kejì oṣù kejì.

column1: English: These plateaus are often referred to as "vidde" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. = Yoruba: Wọ́n ma ń pé plateau yìí ní “vidde” ìtumọ̀ ní ọgbà tí kò ní igi, tó sì fẹ̀. ### English: He is speculated to make a run for president in 2016. = Yoruba:
column2: Àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ ti wà nípa ọkùnrin náà pé yíò díje dunpò ààrẹ lọ́dún 2016.
column3: Ó ti ń kọ̀wé sí àwọn ènìyàn pé ó máa ṣe ààrẹ ní ọdún 2016.

column1: English: The Il-76 has been a major component of both the Russian and Soviet military since the 1970s, and had already seen a serious accident in Russia last month. = Yoruba: Il-76 ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀ sí ikọ̀ ológun Russia àti Soviet láti 1970, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà sì ni ó ti rí ìjàǹbá ní Russia ní oṣù tó kọjá. ### English: Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. = Yoruba: Ní àárin gbùngùn Indus, Ọ̀làjú jẹ́ àkókò Bronze Age, ọlàjú ní àríwá-ìwọ̀oòrùn India fi ara pẹ́ ọ̀pọ̀ ti òde òní tí ó wà ní Pakistan àti àwọn agbègbè ní Aríwá-ìwọ̀oòrùn Afghanista. ### English: He added that "they should not, however, be asked to take on obligations that go beyond their development stage, responsibility and capabilities." = Yoruba:

column1: English: Surface tension happens because the water molecules at the surface of the water are strongly attracted to each other more than they are to the air molecules above them. = Yoruba: Surface tension ṣẹlẹ̀ nítorí water molecules ní orí òkè omi fa ara wọn ju bí air molecules lọ eléyìí tó wà ní òkè wọn. ### English: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. = Yoruba:
column2: Kò ní áṣẹ kankan láti mún òfin owó orí àti ìlànà ìdíyelé láàrin ìpínlẹ̀.
column3: Ó tún kò ní àṣẹ láti dènà òfin àti owó orí tí ó wà láàrin àwọn ìpínlẹ̀.

column1: English: Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. = Yoruba: Awọn ará ilẹ̀ German mú Ọlọ́rún wá súnmọ́ àwọn ẹnìyàn ìbilẹ̀, torí náà wọ́n ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ èdè Estonia. ### English: This was more like the four states of matter (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas, and plasma, though he also theorised that they change into new substances to form what we see. = Yoruba:
column2: Èyí dàbí ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́rin tó se pàtàkì (ní ìlànà kanáà): Líle, olómi, gáàsì, àti pílásíma, lóòótọ́, ó tún se àyípadà tíọ́rì sí ohun èlò tuntun sóhun tí wọ́n ń rí.
column3: Wọn ṣe bíi ẹ̀rí àwọn ẹ̀mí orírun (in the same order): ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀, omi, òjò, àti plasma, sùgbọ́n wọ́n tún sọ pé wọ́n ń ṣẹ̀dá àwọn ẹ̀mí tuntun láti mú ohun tí a rí.

column1: English: A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses. = Yoruba: Calvary ni a ń pe àwọn ikọ̀́ ọmọ ogun to máa n jà lórí ẹṣin. Ìjòkó ẹ̀yìn ẹṣin kòì tí ì sí ní ìgbà náà, fún ìdí èyí, ẹ̀yìn ẹṣin lásan ni awọn Assyrian máa ń jòkó sí láti jà. ### English: Some roads have been damaged, railway service interrupted in the affected areas, and the Noto Airport in Ishikawa prefecture remains closed. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn ọ̀nà kán ti bàjẹ́ wón to dá reluwé dúró níbi tó kàn Papa Ọkọ̀ Ofurufu Noto ní Iṣikawa wà ní títì.
column3: Àwọn ojú ọ̀nà kan ti di bàjẹ́, ìrìn-àjò òfurufú ti di tẹ́lẹ̀ ní àwọn agbègbè tí ó ti bàjẹ́, àti ilé-ọjà òfurufú Noto ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ishikawa ti wà ní ṣíṣí.

column1: English: The band's management company, HK Management Inc., gave no initial reason when they canceled on September 20, but blamed logistical reasons by the next day. = Yoruba: Ile ise ti o n se amojuto eto, Hk Management Inc, ko so idi pataki ti won fi fagi le september 20, sugbon won kede ebi lori ailese amojuto bi o se ye ni ojo keji. ### English: Arly Velasquez of Mexico finished fifteenth in the men's sitting Super-G. New Zealand's Adam Hall finished ninth in the men's standing Super-G. = Yoruba:
column2: Arly Velasquez ti ilẹ̀ Mexico parí nípò karùndínlógún ìjókòó àwọn ọkùnrin Super-G. Adam Hall ti ilẹ̀ New Zealand parí pẹ̀lú ipò kẹsàn án níjòòkó àwọn ọkùnrin Super-G.
column3: Arly Velasquez ti Mexico ni fifunfẹkẹrin ninu idije ti o n se amojuto eto, Super-G ti o n se amojuto eto, ti Adam Hall ti New Zealand ni ifẹkẹrin ninu idije ti o n se amojuto eto, Super-G ti o n se amojuto eto.

column1: English: In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge. = Yoruba: Ní àkótán, ọ̀làjú náà se àyípadà pàtàkì sí ilànà ẹ̀kọ́ àti ìtànkálẹ̀ ìmọ̀. ### English: For some, understanding something about how aircraft work and what happens during a flight may help to overcome a fear which is based on the unknown or on not being in control. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Karno is a well-known but controversial English tutor who taught under Modern Education and King's Glory who claimed to have 9,000 students at the peak of his career. = Yoruba: Karno jẹ́ gbajúgbajà olùkọ́ èdè òyìnbó, ṣùgbọ́n ó tún jẹ́ aláríyànjiyàn olùkọ́ tó ṣiṣẹ́ lábẹ́ Modern Education and king’s Glory to sọpé àwọn ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́sàn-án akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tó ń lékè níbi iṣẹ́ wọn. ### English: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. = Yoruba:

column1: English: In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. = Yoruba: Kódà, kò sí ohunkóhun tí ó dára láti kọ́. ìkọ́ni máa ń wáyé nínú ìrírí láàrín akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ àti ìmọ̀ tí a gbé kalẹ̀. ### English: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park. = Yoruba:
column2: Wọ́n ti kéde Sundarbans gẹ́gẹ́ bí ti UNESCO World Heritage Site. Èyí tó jẹ́ara igbó tówà lẹ́kùn India ní wọn ń pè ní ibùdó àpapọ̀ Sundarbans.
column3: Ìlà Oòrùn Gúúsù Ìwọ̀ Oòrùn India ti jẹ́ kí ó di ibi tí a ti mú un láradá fún UNESCO. Àríwá ìlà Oòrùn Gúúsù Ìwọ̀ Oòrùn India ni a ń pè ní Àríwá Ìlà Oòrùn Gúúsù Ìwọ̀ Oòrùn India.

column1: English: British newspaper The Guardian suggested Deutsche Bank controlled roughly a third of the 1200 shell companies used to accomplish this. = Yoruba: Ìwé ìròyìn Ilẹ̀ gẹ̀ẹ́sì The Guardian da lábàá pé kí ilé ìfowópama Deutsche darí ìdámkta ti àwọn ilé iṣk shell tó tó 1200 tí wọ́n lò láti jẹ́ kí èyí ṣe é ṣe. ### English: The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna. = Yoruba:

column1: English: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. = Yoruba: Ní ìbániníbùba ní ìlà-òrùn Bardia, àwọn ara IÌú Gẹ̀ẹ́si mu olórí Amojú-Ẹ̀rọ Ìpín-Kẹ̀wá Italian, General Lastucci. ### English: According to the lawsuit, waste from the UN camp was not properly sanitized, causing bacteria to enter the tributary of the Artibonite River, one of Haiti's largest. = Yoruba:
column2: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìwé ìpéjọ́, ìdọ̀tí tí àjọ UN kó jáde ní ọ̀nà tí kó boójú mú fún ìlera, ṣe okùnfà àwọn kòkòrò àrùn tó wọ ibùdó odò Artbonite, ìkan lára èyí tó tóbi jù ní Haiti .
column3: Lẹ́yìn ìgbẹ́jọ́, àwọn ewé tí ó ń jáde láti UN camp kò jẹ́ kí ó tọ́, ó sì mú kí àwọn kòkòrò bá àyíká Artibonite River, ọ̀kan nínú àwọn odò tí ó tóbi jùlọ ní Haiti, lọ.

column1: English: It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more. = Yoruba: Ń se ló dàbí ọ̀nà ati má a tan àwọn ènìyàn jẹ́, kíwọ́n lè gbàgbọ́ wípé wọ́n nílò àti má a sanwó sí i. ### English: As long as you stay in this zone, you can generally cross borders without going through passport control checkpoints again. = Yoruba:
column2: Nìwọ̀n ìgbà tí o bá dúró sí agbègbè yí, o lè rékọjá àwọn ẹnubodè láìsí àwọn àyẹ̀wò ìsakóso ìwé̀ ìrìnnà.
column3: Tí o bá wà ní àyíká yìí, o lè gba ibodè ibodè láì gba àyẹ̀wò àkọsílẹ̀ ẹ̀rọ-ayélujára mọ́.

column1: English: The International Olympic Committee voted to include the sports at its executive board meeting in Berlin today. Rugby, specifically rugby union, and golf were selected over five other sports to be considered to participate in the Olympics. = Yoruba: Àwọn aláṣẹ Ìgbìmọ̀ Olympic làgbáláayé ninú ìpàdé tí o wáyé ni Berlin lónìí dìbò láti ṣe àfikún eré-ìdárayá nínú ìpàdé ìgbìmọ̀ aláṣẹ. Rugby, pàápàá ẹgbẹ́ Rugby àti golf ni wọ́n sàyàn nínú àwọn eré ìdárayá mìíràn bíi márùn ún tí wọ́n gbé kalẹ̀ láti kópa nínú ìdíje Olympics. ### English: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman." = Yoruba:
column2: Tommy Dreamer sọ wípé “Luna jẹ Ọbabìnrin Alailopláìlópin Àkọ́kọ́. Olùṣàkóso mi àkọ́kọ́. Luna ṣe aláìsíní alé òṣùpá mejiméjì. Aláìlẹ́gbé púpò bí rẹ. Alágbára obìnrin .”
column3: Tommy Dreamer ni Luna ni àkọ́kọ́ Queen of Extreme. Àkọ́kọ́ àgbà mi. Luna kò sí kú láti ọjọ́ kan tí ó kù ni ọjọ́ kan tí ó kù. Ìwàrán ní ó. Ònìyàn obìnrin.

column1: English: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green. = Yoruba: Orí koróko ni wọ́n tí ń se eré náà, àti pé wọ́n má ń gé koríko tó wà ní ẹ̀bá ihò kúrú èyí tí wọ́n ń pè ní àwọ̀ ewéko. ### English: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. = Yoruba:
column2: Ní gbangba sàfánà, ó ṣòro fún pírámètì tí ęya ara oúnjẹ́ jíję rẹ̀ jọ ti èyàn, láti rí ásìdì amino tí ara rẹ̀ ní lò láti ara ewé.

column1: English: Following the process, HJR-3 will be reviewed again by the next elected legislature in either 2015 or 2016 to remain in process. = Yoruba: Ní sísèntèlé ìlànà náà, àwọn ìgbìmò asòfin ti a máà yan máà tún sẹ àgbéyèwò HJR-3, ní odún 2015 tàbí 2016 kó ma sàíj´ ìlànà. ### English: Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way of circumventing both political censorship and commercial IP-geofiltering. = Yoruba: Àwọn olùpèsè VPN (ìtàkùn aláfojúrí ọlọ́danni) jẹ́ ọ̀nà kan tó dára jùlọ láti wá ọ̀nà àbáyọ sáwọn ọ̀rọ̀ òṣèlú tí a fi pamọ́ àti dídí ìdúrógbaari okoòwò. ### English: To the north and within easy reach is the romantic and fascinating town of Sintra and which was made famous to foreigners after a glowing account of its splendours recorded by Lord Byron. = Yoruba:
column2: Sí àríwá àti láàrín àwọn ibi tí kò nù ni a ti rí ìlú Sintra tí ó rẹwà fún ìfẹ́ tí ó sì jẹ ojú ní gbèsè, ní èyí tí ó di gbajúgbajà fún àwọn ènìyàn láti ilẹ̀ òkèrè lẹ́yìn tí Lord Byron kọ nípa rẹ.
column3: Láti apá gúúsù àti ní ìhà tí ó rọrùn láti dé ni ìlú tí ó ń bọ̀wọ̀ fún ìfẹ́ àti tí ó ń fẹ̀hónú hàn tí ó ń jẹ́ Sintra, tí ó jẹ́ ìlú tí ó gbajúmọ̀ fún àwọn ọmọ abínibí ní ilẹ̀ òkèèrè lẹ́yìn àkọsílẹ̀ ìfẹ́ tí Lord Byron kọ nípa rẹ̀.

column1: English: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. = Yoruba: Orile ede Turkey je eyiti okun nla meta yi ka: okun Aegean ni apa iwo oorun, Okun Dudu ni ariwa ati Okun Medirettanean ni apa ila oorun. ### English: Australia's Mitchell Gourley finished eleventh in the men's standing Super-G. Czech competitor Oldrich Jelinek finished sixteenth in the men's sitting Super-G. = Yoruba:
column2: Mitchell Gourley ti ilẹ̀ Australia parí pẹ̀lú ipò kọkànlá nínú àwọn ọkùnrin tó wà nínú ìdíje Super-G. Czech tí Oldrich Jelinek sì parí pẹ̀lú ipò kẹrìndínlógún ìdíje super-G.
column3: Australia's Mitchell Gourley ni won ni eleventh ni won ni men's standing Super-G. Czech competitor Oldrich Jelinek ni won ni sixteenth ni won ni men's sitting Super-G.

column1: English: A tornado is a spinning column of very low-pressure air, which sucks the surrounding air inward and upward. = Yoruba: Ìjì líle jẹ́ afẹ́fẹ́ tó kórajọ láti kékeré, gbá àwọn atẹ́gùn àyíká rẹ̀ nínú àti lóde pọ̀ mọ́ra. ### English: Police superintendent Chandra Shekhar Solanki said the accused appeared in court with covered faces. = Yoruba:

column1: English: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. column1: English: The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light". = Yoruba: Ibi apá kan níta tí a lè̀rí nígbà tàà bá wo oòrùn ní à ń pè̀ ní àwòrán-àyíká, èyí tó túnmò sí “iná bọlù”. ### English: Michael Schumacher ended his race not long after Alonso, because of the suspension damage in the numerous battles during the race. = Yoruba:

column2: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ìtunmọ̀ ìpinu ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ pín àbá méjì, pé ìdágbàsóké ìms ẹ̀rọ fún rarẹ̀ fàyègba ọ̀nà tó jù àṣà àti òṣèlù lọ, ìms ẹ̀rọ nà ní “ipa” lóri àwùjọ tí a jogúnbá, jú àwùjọ ìlóniníyè lọ.
column3: Àwọn àyẹ̀wò tí ó ń ṣe nípa ìdàgbàsókè ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá ní í ṣe pẹ̀lú àìmọ̀kan méjì: 1. Àìmọ̀kan pé ìdàgbàsókè ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá yíò tẹ̀lé ọ̀nà kan pàtó tí kò ní ṣe é ṣe pẹ̀lú ẹ̀yà tàbí ìṣèjọba. 2. Àìmọ̀kan pé ẹ̀rọ-ayárabíàṣá yíò ní "àbájáde" tí ó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú àwùjọ tí ó jẹ́ àìmọ̀kan, tí kò ní ṣe é ṣe pẹ̀lú ìṣèjọba.

column1: English: The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean. = Yoruba: Cook Island jẹ island orílẹ́ èdè tó wà ní ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀fẹ́ pẹ̀lú ìlú New Zealand, tó wà ní Polynesia, ní àárín South Pacific Ocean. ### English: The eathquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday). = Yoruba:
column2: Ìṣẹlẹ ilẹ̀ ríru náà kọlu Mariana ní dédé agogo méje kọjá ìṣẹ́jú mọ́kàndínlógún àárọ̀, tí ó sì jẹ́ (09:19 p.m. GMT ọjọ́ ẹtì) ní àsìkò tiwa.
column3: Earthquake ti ṣọṣẹ́ ní Mariana ní àsìkò tí a kọ sí ní ọjọ́ kọkàndínlógún oṣù kọkànlá (ọjọ́ kọkàndínlógún oṣù kọkànlá), ní àsìkò tí a kọ sí ní ọjọ́ kọkàndínlógún oṣù kọkànlá (ọjọ́ kọkàndínlógún oṣù kọkànlá).

column1: English: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. = Yoruba: Luxembourg ní ìtàn tó gùn ṣùgbọ́n déètì òmìnira rẹ láti 1839.. ### English: But Prime Minister John Howard has said the act was only to safeguard the facilities of the hospital from being downgraded by the Tasmanian government, in giving an extra AUD$45 million. = Yoruba:
column2: Ṣùgbọ́n Mínísítà àgbà, John Howard ti sọ wípé àbá náà wà fún àbò àwọn ohun èlò ilé ìwòsàn náà, kí ìjọba Tasmanian má ba à fi wọ́lẹ̀, ní gbigbé milíọ́nù márùndínlógójì dọ́là sílẹ̀.
column3: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé Ààrẹ John Howard ti sọ wí pé òfin náà jẹ́ láti dáàbò bo àwọn ohun amáyédẹrùn tí ilé ìwòsàn náà ní láti má di kíkọ́kọ́ ní àǹfààní láti gba AUD$45 mílíọ̀nù.

column1: English: A tornado is a spinning column of very low-pressure air, which sucks the surrounding air inward and upward. = Yoruba: Ìjì líle jẹ́ afẹ́fẹ́ tó kórajọ láti kékeré, gbá àwọn atẹ́gùn àyíká rẹ̀ nínú àti lóde pọ̀ mọ́ra. ### English: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. = Yoruba:
column2: Ọba búburú Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette àwọn ọmọ wọn kékèké méjì ( Marie Therese, ọmọ ọdún mọ́kànlá àti Louis-Charles ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rin) àti àbúrò ọba obìnrin Madam Elizabeth, ní ọjọ́ kẹfà, oṣù kẹwa ọdún 1789, ni ọ̀gọọrọ̀ àwọn ìyá ọlọ́jà lé jáde pada sí Paris láti Versailles.
column3: Oba Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, àwọn ọmọ wọn méjì (11 ọdún Marie Therese àti ọmọ ọdún 4 Louis-Charles) àti àbúrò ọba, Àyá Elizabeth, ní oṣù Kẹwàá ọdún 1789, jẹ́ kó kúrò ní Versailles pẹ̀lú àwọn obìnrin tí ó ń wá ọjà.

column1: English: Fewer than a thousand cases have ever been reported in humans, but some of them have been fatal. = Yoruba: Àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí wọn ti fi rojo lára èyàn ò tó egberun, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn kan tí wọ́n rí gbẹ̀mí lọ. ### English: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team. = Yoruba:

column3: Ó yẹ kí o mọ̀ wí pé, olórí ni ó ní ẹ̀tọ́ láti mú kí ẹgbẹ́ náà yọrí sí rere tàbí kó yọrí sí ìdààmú.

column1: English: A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. = Yoruba: Ẹranko Triceratop oníwo mẹ́ta ti lè lo ęnú rẹ̀ tó le láti ya àwọn ewé kúrò kótó ję ẹ̀yìn igi náà. ### English: . column1: English: Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world. = Yoruba: Ìfihàn àwòrán rẹ lóorèkòorẹ́ nínú orin, ẹrẹ́, lítírẹ́sọ̀ àti àsa olókìkí ti ran Ìlu náà áti sọ ámí rẹ di mímọ̀ ní gbogbo àgbáyẹ́. ### English: Majorcan cuisine, like that of similar zones in the Mediterranean, is based on bread, vegetables and meat (specially pork), and uses olive oil throughout. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìlànà ìdáná àwọn Majorcan bí i ti àwọn tó wà ní agbègbè omi, ló dá lórí búrẹ́dì, ẹ̀fọ́ àti ẹran (pàápàá jùlọ ẹran ẹlẹ́dẹ̀), tí wọ́n si ma ń lo òróró ólìfù.
column3: Ìlúu Majorca ní ìlu tí ó ní àkàrà, ẹyín àti ẹyin (àti pọ́ọ̀lù) tí ó sì ní àjẹjù olèe òjíá tí ó sì ń lo àjẹjù olèe òjíá ní gbogbo ìgbà.

column1: English: At its peak, Tropical Cyclone Gonu, named for a bag of palm leaves in the language of the Maldives, reached sustained winds of 240 kilometers an hour (149 miles per hour) . = Yoruba: Lókè tẹ́ntẹ́n,Tropical Cyclone Gonu, ti sọ lórúkọ fún àpò ẹwẹ́ igi ọ̀pẹ ni èdè Maldives, dẹ gẹ̀rẹ́gẹ̀rẹ́ ìjì fún ogójìlénígba ìbùsọ̀ ní wákàtí kan (òkàndínládọ́ta ìbùsọ̀ ni wákàtí kan). ### English: In an interview, he said the new variant was "very highly troubling and alarming because of the very high fatality rate." = Yoruba:

column1: English: As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. Èyí ni ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìlàlọ́yẹ̀. ### English: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Fred is the strongest tropical cyclone ever recorded so far south and east in the Atlantic since the advent of satellite imagery, and only the third major hurricane on record east of 35°W. = Yoruba: Fred jẹ́ ẹni tó lé wẹ́ nínu ìjì òjò tó sì lágbára jù ní gúsù àti ìla oòrùn ní Atlantic láti ìgbà tí wọ́n ti dá àwòrán sátẹ́láìtì sílẹ̀, àti pé ìjì líle tó lágbára kẹta ní a ti sàkọsílẹ̀ rẹ̀ ní ìla oòrùn 35°W. ### English: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. = Yoruba:
column2: Nígbà tí ẹgbẹ́ kékeré nǹkan abẹ̀mí (tó kéré níye) bá yẹra kúrò lọ́dọ̀ àwọn olùgbé àkọ́kọ́ tíwọ́n ti wá (bí i kí wọ́n kúrò lórí òkè àbí odò tàbí tí wọ́n bá kó lọ sí erékùsù tuntun kí wọ́n má lè padà mọ́) wọ́n yíò ri wípé wọ́n bára wọn ní àyíká tó yàtọ̀ ju ibi tí wọ́n wà tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ.
column3: Bí àwọn ẹ̀yà ara kan bá pín sí méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ (àti bí wọ́n bá ń lọ sí ibi tí wọn kò lè padà sí) wọn ó máa ń rí ara wọn ní ibi tí wọn kò ti rí wọn rí tẹ́lẹ̀.

column1: English: They're regaling each other with stories from their hometowns, told in their distinct accents and local argot. = Yoruba: Wọ́n ń dára wọn lára yá pẹ̀lú àwọn ìtàn láti ìlú wọn; oníkàlùkù sọ àwọn ìtàn náà pẹ̀lú ìsọ̀rọ̀sì èdè àdúgbò wọn. ### English: People have known about basic chemical elements such as gold, silver, and copper from antiquity, as these can all be discovered in nature in native form and are relatively simple to mine with primitive tools. = Yoruba:

column3: Wọ́n ti mọ̀ nípa àwọn elementu kẹ́míkà bíi fàdákà, wúrà àti kẹ̀kẹ́ láti ìgbà tí ó ti wà láàrín àwọn ènìyàn, nítorí pé gbogbo wọn ni wọ́n lè rí nínú ilẹ̀ ní ìní ìbílẹ̀ wọn, wọ́n sì lè mú wọn pẹ̀lú àwọn ohun èlò àkọ́kọ́.

column1: English: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). = Yoruba: MRI dálórí kàyéfì fisiksi ta n pè ní nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), tí Felisi Boṣi (tó n ṣiṣẹ́ ní Ile Iwe Giga Stanfodi) àti Edwodi Pọseli (láti Ile Iwe Giga Hafadi) wárí ní 1930s. ### English: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for "way of the guru". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. = Yoruba: Àwọn Sikhs ń pe ẹ̀sìn wọn ní Gurmat, èyí tí wọ́n pè ní Punjabi “nílànì àwọn guru”. column1: English: Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. = Yoruba: Agbẹ̀gbẹ̀ Turkey jẹ́ orílé-èdè ẹ̀kẹtàdínlógójí ní tìtòbi, o jẹ iyẹ ìwọ̀n olú ílu Faransé àti ílu ọba lápapò. ### English: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison. = Yoruba:
column2: O de si orile ede US, pelu senti 4, to je owo to ni laye lorun, pelu iwe ewi, pelu iwe akosile oniduro lati odo Charles Batchelor (oga re ni ise ti o se gbeyin) si Thomas Edison.
column3: Ó dé US ní 4 peni sí i, ìwé-ọkọ̀-ọkọ̀-ọkọ̀ kan, àti àkọsílẹ̀-ọkọ̀-ọkọ̀ kan láti Charles Batchelor (ìgbìmọ̀ rẹ̀ nínú iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀) sí Thomas Edison.

column1: English: An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry. = Yoruba: Ilé iṣẹ́ to ṣe pàtàkì ní ilé iṣẹ́ epo Venezuelans jẹ́, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìdá kan nínú àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè ló ń ṣiṣẹ níbẹ̀. ### English: It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research. = Yoruba:

column3: Kí ó tó bẹ́ẹ̀, àyẹ̀wò, àti àyẹ̀wò jẹ́ àyẹ̀wò tí a fi ń ṣàyẹ̀wò àìmọ̀ kan tàbí òmíràn, tí a sì ń béèrè ìbéèrè àti tí a sì ń ṣe àkíyèsí, ó tún ń darí iṣẹ́ ìwádìí.

column1: English: If just taking a photo of something isn't allowed, then you shouldn't even think of recording a video of it. = Yoruba: Tí a kò bá fàyègba yíya àwòrán ǹkan, má rò pé o lé ṣe fídíò rẹ̀. ### English: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present. = Yoruba:
column2: Ottawa je ilu ti o re wa ni Canada, olu-ilu elede meji ti o kun fun gbongan isafihan ise owo ati ile iselojo pa mo si ti o n se afihan ana ati oni Canada.
column3: Ottawa ni orílè-èdè Canada tí ó ní àwo orin, tí ó sì ní ilé-ìwé tí ó ní àwòrán tí ó ń fi hàn nípa ìtàn àti òde-òní orílẹ̀-èdè náà.

column1: English: And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. = Yoruba: Nìgbàtí wọ́n padà sí àríwá nípasẹ̀ ìwọ oòrùn, lẹ́ẹ̀kan si nígbàtí wọ́n gba odò Mara kọjá, lẹ́yìn àkókò òjò ní oṣù kẹrin. ### English: He was initially hospitalised in the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season). = Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn ló ma ń gbààyè sílẹ̀ saájú (torí ọkọ̀ ojú omi ti ma ń kún fọ́fọ́ láwọn àkókò tó ga). ### English: A person working in a garage near where the accident occurred said: "There were children waiting to cross the road and they were all screaming and crying." = Yoruba:

column3: Àkọlé kan tó wà ní ibi tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà ti wáyé sọ pé: “Àwọn ọmọ kan wà tí wọ́n ń dúró de láti gba ojú ọ̀nà kọjá, wọ́n sì ń kígbe àti ń kọ̀wé.”

column1: English: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. = Yoruba: Àwọn ìràwọ̀ ma n taná nítorí agbára tón jáde nígbàtí aidrojini atọ́mu ba papò (tàbí sopọ̀) láti di ẹ́límẹ́ntì tó wúwo. ### English: Such children are called "feral" or wild. column1: English: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. = Yoruba: Bí ogun ilẹ̀ Faransé tí ṣe parí, Germany bẹ̀rẹ̀ si ní gbaradì láti gbógun ti erékùsù ilẹ̀ Britain. ### English: While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The precipitation, reaching 6.34 inches at a gauge on Oahu, was described as "beneficial". = Yoruba: Ìwọ́n ojò rírọ̀ náà, tó dé 6.34 ní Oahu, ní wọ́n ṣàpèjúwè gẹ́gẹ́ bí èyí tóní “àǹfàn.” ### English: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). = Yoruba:

column1: English: Registration is an additional requirement for the visa process. In some countries, you must register your presence and address where you are staying with the local authorities. = Yoruba: Ìforúkọsílẹ̀ jẹ́ àfikún tí a nílò fún ìṣètò visa. Ní àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè kànkan, o ní láti forúkọsílẹ̀ fún wíwá rẹ àti àdírẹ́sì ibi tí ò ń gbé fún àwọn tó wà ní ipò àṣẹ sílẹ̀. ### English: This seems sensible, because the Earth doesn't feel as if it's moving, does it? = Yoruba:
column2: Ẹ̀yí mú ọpọlọ wá, torí wípé kò dà bí ẹni wípé pé ayé ń yí, àbí ó dàábẹ̀?
column3: Ó dà bíi pé ó tọ́, nítorí pé ayé kì í ṣe pé ó ń lọ, o,?

column1: English: The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light". = Yoruba: Ibi apá kan níta tí a lè̀rí nígbà tàà bá wo oòrùn ní à ń pè̀ ní àwòrán-àyíká, èyí tó túnmò sí “iná bọlù”. ### English: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ Taiwan ní 15th century níbi tí àwọn awakọ̀ ojú omi Europe gbà kọjà ṣàkọsílẹ̀ orúkọ island na gẹ́gẹ́ bí IIha Formosa, tàbí island tó rẹwà.
column3: Taiwan ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ìgbà tí àwọn oníṣòwò tí ó ń lọ láti ilẹ̀ Europe tí wọ́n ń kọjá níbẹ̀ ní ọdún 1500 tí wọ́n sì ń kọ orúkọ rẹ̀ sí Ilha Formosa, tàbí “ilẹ̀ tí ó dára jùlọ”.

column1: English: The algae produces a neurotoxin that can disable nerves in both humans and fish. = Yoruba: Àwọn ewé ń pèsè oró tó lè sèpalára sọ́fun àwọn èèyàn àti ẹja. ### English: The 802.11n standard operates on both the 2.4Ghz and 5.0Ghz frequencies. = Yoruba:
column2: Eto 802.11n sise pelu eto igbohun si afefe 2.4Ghz ati 5.0Ghz.
column3: Ìtọ́jú àwo-ọ̀rọ̀ 802.11n ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí àwọn ìró 2.4Ghz àti 5.0Ghz.

column1: English: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. = Yoruba: Àwọn elimenti ati compandi lè pàrọ̀ ara láti dídáwà kan sí òmíràn láì yípadà. ### English: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìtàkùn Blog náà lè se ìrànwọ́ fún ìkọ̀wé àwọn akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́. Nígbàtí àwọn akẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìrírí ìtàkùn blog ti wọn pẹ̀lú ìlo èdè àti àkọtọ́ tó wọ́, wíwà nílẹ̀ àwọn èrò ma ń yí èyí padà.
column3: Awọn ile-iwe alakọbẹrẹ le ṣe ipaniyan fun awọn akẹkọọ lati ṣe agbara wọn. Lati igba ti awọn akẹkọọ ti wọn ti bẹrẹ ile-iwe wọn ni awọn ẹrọ ayelujara, wọn maa n ṣe agbara wọn. Lati igba naa, awọn ẹrọ ayelujara maa n ṣe agbara wọn.

column1: English: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman. = Yoruba: Phnom Krom, kìlómítà méjìlà gúsù ìwọ ̀oòrun Siem Reap. Ibi Ìjọsìn tí wọ́n kọ́ sí òpin sẹńtúrì kẹsan, nígbàtí Ọba Yasovarman wà ní orí oy. ### English: In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp. = Yoruba:
column2: NÍ àfikún, mọ̀ pé òórùn ma ń fa béárì àti àwọn ęranko inú igbó mìíràn, torínáà yàgò fún gbígbé tàbi síse àwọn oúnjẹ́ tí ó ní òrùn púpọ̀, jẹ́kí ibi ìpàgọ́ rẹ mọ́ tótó nígbàgbogbo.
column3: Kò sí àkíyèsí pé odò ń mú àwọn ẹyẹ àti àwọn ẹranko mìíràn wá, ó sì yẹ kí o má ṣe kó tàbí kó o máa jẹ oúnjẹ tí ó ń mú odò wá, àti pé o ní láti máa gbé ilé tí ó tọ́.

column1: English: At its peak, Tropical Cyclone Gonu, named for a bag of palm leaves in the language of the Maldives, reached sustained winds of 240 kilometers an hour (149 miles per hour) . = Yoruba: Lókè tẹ́ntẹ́n,Tropical Cyclone Gonu, ti sọ lórúkọ fún àpò ẹwẹ́ igi ọ̀pẹ ni èdè Maldives, dẹ gẹ̀rẹ́gẹ̀rẹ́ ìjì fún ogójìlénígba ìbùsọ̀ ní wákàtí kan (òkàndínládọ́ta ìbùsọ̀ ni wákàtí kan). ### English: Because the dinosaur feathers do not have a well-developed shaft, called a rachis, but do have other features of feathers — barbs and barbules — the researchers inferred the rachis was likely a later evolutionary development that these other features. = Yoruba:
column2: Nítorí ìyẹ́ dánísọ̀̀ kò ní ọpá tó gbó káká, tí wọ́n ń pè ní rachis, ṣùgbọ́n ó ní àwọn àbùdá ìyé mìíràn – barbs àti barbules – àwọn aṣèwádìí sọ ohun tó jọ́ wípé rachis ṣeéṣe kí o jẹ́ àbùdá ìyẹ́ tí ó ti wà tipẹ́ síwájú àwọn ìyók.

column1: English: The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. = Yoruba: Ìdí gbòógì fú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí ni àbájáde àwọn ààlá tó hàn kedere fún nínawọ́jà gígùn àkókò láàrin àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ REM tó sẹ́kù. ### English: A doctor who worked at Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania will be charged with aggravated murder after her mother was found dead in the trunk of her car Wednesday, authorities in Ohio say. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn agbófinro ni Ohio sọ pé, Oníṣègùn tó ṣiṣẹ́ ni ilé ìwòsàn àwọn ọmọdé tí ó wà ní Pittsburgh, ni Pennsylvania ni wọn yóò fi ẹ̀sùn ìpànìyàn kàn lẹ́yìn tí wọn bá òkú ìyá rẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ọkọ̀ rẹ̀ ní ọjọ́rú.
column3: A doctor tí ó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania yóò jẹ́ kí a fi ẹ̀sùn ìpànìyàn tí ó burú jùlọ kàn án lẹ́yìn tí ìyá rẹ̀ jẹ́ kí a rí i ní àhámọ́ ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ ní ọjọ́ kejìdínlógún oṣù kejì, àwọn aláṣẹ ní Ohio sọ.

column1: English: The translation engines have improved dramatically, and now often give more or less correct translations (and more seldom gibberish), but some care is due, as they still may have gotten it all wrong. = Yoruba: Àwọn èrọ atúmò èdè ti dárasi láìsí ánì-àní, pèlú níbàyí o ń fi ìtumọ̀ èdè dárá ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà (àti ìwòmba àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ díẹ̀ tí kò ní ìtumọ̀), sùgbọ́n àwọn àyẹ̀wò díẹ̀ se pàtakì nítorí wọ́n lè gbe gbági. ### English: In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC. = Yoruba:
column2: Ni eba ipari odun 2017, Siminoff fi ara han lori itakun mohun maworan ti awon ontaja QVC.

column1: English: Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. column1: English: Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. = Yoruba: Àwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹ́nsì ma n pè ní “stimulated emission of radiation” torí àwọn átọ́mù ma ń fura sí iná tó ràn èyí ṣokùn fa kí fotoni ina maa jáde,iná dẹ̀ jẹ́ irúfẹ́ redieṣọ́ni. ### English: The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The cell is the basic unit of all living things, and all organisms are composed of one or more cells. = Yoruba: Sẹ́ẹ̀lì jẹ́ ǹkan pàtàkì ní ara gbogbo ǹkan tó ń mí, àti pé gbogbo organism lóní sẹ́ẹ̀lì kan tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ ní ara wọn. ### English: The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìlú náà yàtọ̀ gédégbé sí àwọn ìlú orílẹ̀èdè yòókù, nítoríwípé ó fara pẹ́ Áràbù ju àwọn adúláwọ̀ lọ.
column3: Ìlú náà ní ìríran tí ó ga ju àwọn ìlú míràn ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà lọ, nítorí pé ó ní ìríran tí ó ga ju ti ilẹ̀ Áfríkà lọ.

column1: English: Today's announcement also extended the government's commitment made in March of this year to fund extra carriages. = Yoruba: Ikede oni na sí ileri ijoba lati fowo sí eru gbigbe sii ti wọ́́n se ní Èbìbí. ### English: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class. = Yoruba:
column2: Ọgbọ́n àmúṣe pèsè ọ̀nà àbáyọ pẹlú àwọn ìrìn àjo lọ́ sí pápá. Àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lè wo àwọn iṣẹ́ ọnà tí ó wà ní ilé ìkó àwọn iṣẹ́ ọnà sí, lọ wo ilé iṣẹ́ ẹja ní ọ̀ṣọ́ sí, tàbí kí wọ́n máa wo àwọn iṣẹ́ ọnà tí ó rẹwà bí wọ́n ṣe wà ní kílásì wọn.

column1: English: Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. = Yoruba: Lusemboogi ti gbiyanju lati je orileede ti kii da si oro sugbon ni Ogun Agbaye Ikini Ati Ikeji, Jamani fi agbara gba won. ### English: As one example, American citizens in the Middle East might face different situations from Europeans or Arabs. = Yoruba:

column1: English: The New Zealand police had trouble using their speed radar guns to see how fast Mr Reid was going because of how low Black Beauty is, and the only time the police managed to clock Mr Reid was when he slowed down to 160km/h. = Yoruba: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá ilẹ̀ New Zealand ní ìṣòro lílo ìbọn speed radar wọn láti rí bí Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Reid ṣe ń sáré tó, nítorí bí ẹwà ẹ̀nìyàn dudu ti ri, ẹ̀ẹ̀kan soso tí àwọn ọlọ́pàá yóò rí bí Ọgbẹ́ni Reid ṣe ń sáré sí ni ìgbà tí Ó sinmi díẹ̀, èyi ni ọgọ́ta kìlómíta láàrin wákàtí. ### English: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Surface tension happens because the water molecules at the surface of the water are strongly attracted to each other more than they are to the air molecules above them. = Yoruba: Surface tension ṣẹlẹ̀ nítorí water molecules ní orí òkè omi fa ara wọn ju bí air molecules lọ eléyìí tó wà ní òkè wọn. ### English: Her other race, the Giant Slalom, saw her finish in tenth in the women's sitting group with a combined run time of 4:41.30, 2:11.60 minutes slower than first place finisher Austrian Claudia Loesch and 1:09.02 minutes slower than the ninth place finisher Gyöngyi Dani of Hungary. = Yoruba:

column1: English: He joined them in 1945 and stayed until 1958. = Yoruba: Ó dara pọ̀ mọ́wọn ní ọdún 1945, ó sì dúró di ọdún 1958. ### English: Some cruises feature Berlin, Germany in the brochures. As you can see from the map above Berlin is no where near the sea and a visit to the city is not included in the price of the cruise. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn ọkọ̀ ìgbafẹ́ ojú omi sàfihàn ìlú Berlin, Germany nínú ìwé ìléwọ́. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí o ti ríi nínú áwòrán atọ́ka ayé, Ìlú Berlin kò sí ní agbègbè òkun àti pé ìbẹ̀wò sí ìlú náà kò sí nínú owó ọkọ̀ ojú omi.
column3: Àwọn cruise kan wà tí wọ́n fi Berlin, Germany hàn nínú ìwé ẹ̀rí wọn. Bí ẹ ṣe lè rí i nínú àwòkọ map tó wà ní ìsàlẹ̀ yìí, Berlin kò sí níbẹ̀, àti pé, ìrìn-àjò sí ìlú náà kò jẹ́ mímọ́ nínú owó cruise náà.

column1: English: Many buildings are quite beautiful to look at and the view from a tall building or from a cleverly-positioned window can be a beauty to behold. = Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ilẹ́ màa ń dára láti wò àti wípẹ́ ìwòye láti orí ilé gogoro tàbí làti ojú fèrèsè ta fi ọgbọ́n gbẹ̀kalè màa ǹ dára láti wò. ### English: The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report "truly regrettable." = Yoruba:

column3: Ilé iṣẹ́ náà fèsì nípa wí pé postponement ti Apple fún ìkéde náà jẹ́ "truly regrettable".

column1: English: The Health Minister expressed concern both for the welfare of individuals taking advantage of the temporary legality of the substances involved, and for drug-related convictions handed down since the now-unconstitutional changes came into effect. = Yoruba: Minista Ilera so pe o kaanu fun oro itoju awon to n lo anfani pe won ti fowo si ilo awon ogun naa fun igba die, ati fun awon ti won ran si ewon nitori ogun, ti won gbe wa lati igba ti awon ayipada to ti wa lodi si konstitution, ti waye. ### English: Adekoya has since been in Edinburgh Sheriff Court charged with murdering her son. = Yoruba:

column1: English: When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. = Yoruba: Nígbàtí àwọn èèyàn tó wà níbùgbé bá ní ìdánimọ̀ to ní í se pẹ̀lú ìjọra jíìnì, wọ́n má ń pèwọ́n ní oníjọra. ### English: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." column2: Blogging, “ti kàn án nípá fáwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ láti fẹ ní ìmọ̀ àti òye kíkún nípa ayé tó yí wọn ká” èròǹgbà àti ìlò láti wo ṣàkun ohun tí àwọn olùgbọ́ ń fẹ́ kí wọn sì ṣe e fún wọn ni ó mú kí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ gbọ́n nínú gbọ́n ní ìlta, tí wọ́n si ń ṣe ohun tó móríyá. (Toto, 2004)

column1: English: On October 7 an engine separated on takeoff, without injuries. column3: Ó ní Mick O'Flynn, Ààrẹ Park Conservation and Heritage pẹ̀lú NPWS, àwọn mẹ́rin tí wọ́n yàn fún àkọ́kọ́ iṣẹ́ abẹ, gba ìtọ́jú àti ìkọ́ni tó kún fún àyípadà nípa ààbò àti ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ.

column1: English: When the capsule gets to Earth and enters the atmosphere, at about 5am (eastern time), it is expected to put on quite a light show for folks in Northern California, Oregon, Nevada, and Utah. = Yoruba: Bí kápísù bá dé inú ayé tí ó wọ inú afẹ́fẹ́, àti ní ǹkan bi í aago márùn ún òwúrọ̀ (àkókò ìlà òrùn) èyí ni wọ́n ń retí wípé yíó sàfihàn eré ráńpẹ́ fáwọn èèyàn tó wà ní àríwá California, Oregon, Nevada, àti Utah. ### English: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method. = Yoruba:
column2: Wọn lẹ má gba káàdì àwìn ní àwọn ìrékùsù tó wa ní pípépe, àmọ wọn lẹ gba àwọn owó ìlú Ọba àti ìlú Amèrìká, kọ́kọ́ sẹ àyèwo pèlú àwọn to ni ibè làti mọ nkan tí wọn lẹ gba gẹ́gẹ́ bii ìlànà ìsanwó.
column3: On the outlying islands, it is likely that credit cards will not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.

column1: English: The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence. = Yoruba: Àwọn Mapuche náà jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára èèyàn Amẹrika tó gba òmìnira kẹ́yìn, tí wọn kò kó sínú ẹ̀yà tó ń sọ èdè Spain títí di ìgbà tí ilẹ́ Chile gba òmìnira. ### English: An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo. = Yoruba:

column3: Àkọ́kọ́ ni pé kí o lọ sí, fi àwòrán, àti kọ́ nípa organgatuangs ní Borno.

column1: English: However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. = Yoruba: Àmọ́ ní 991 Ẹ́tẹ́rẹ́ẹ̀dì bá ẹgbẹ́ ogun Fáikini pàdé tí ó tóbi jù gbogbo ẹgbẹ́ ogun lọ láti ìgbà tí Gútírùmi tí ó wáyé ní ọgọ́run ọdún tí ó ṣájú. ### English: Pronunciation is relatively easy in Italian since most words are pronounced exactly how they are written = Yoruba:

column1: English: These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph). = Yoruba: Ìjì líle ti gbì tó okòódínníẹ̀dẹ́gbẹ̀ta kìlómítà láàrin wákàtí (133 m/s; 300 mph). ### English: Entertainment news website TMZ understands the photographer stopped his vehicle on the other side of Sepulveda Boulevard and attempted to take pictures of the police stop before crossing the road and continuing, prompting the California Highway Patrol police officer conducting the traffic stop to order him back across, twice. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìtàkùn Ìròyìn ìdárayá tí a mọ̀ sí TMZ jẹ́ kó yé pé àayàwòrán náà dá ọkọ̀ òun dúró lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ kejì Sepulveda Boulevard, ó sì gbìyànjú láti ya àwòránibi ìdánidúró àwọn ọlọ́pàá kí ó tó sọdá sí òdì kejì tí ó sì tẹ̀síwájú, ní èyí tí ó mú kí àwọn ọlọ́pàá òpópónà California tí wọn n ṣe ètò sún kẹrẹ̀ fà kẹrẹ ọkọ dáa dúró kí o padà ní ẹ̀ẹ̀méj.
column3: Ìwé ìròyìn ìgbéròyìnjáde TMZ gbà pé olùfẹ̀hónúhàn náà dúró sí apá kejì odò Sepulveda Boulevard, ó sì gbìyànjú láti wo fóònù fínnífínní, ó sì tún padà sí apá kejì, èyí tí ó mú kí olùdarí fóònù fínnífínní tí ó ń ṣe àyẹ̀wò fóònù fínnífínní ní abúlé Los Angeles, ó mú un padà sí apá kejì, méjì.

column1: English: Access to these services is often through a toll-free telephone number that can be called from most phones without charge. = Yoruba: Wíwọle sí àwọn isé yíì lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà màà n jẹ́ nípasè ẹ̀rọ fóònù ọ̀fẹ́ tí o lẹ pè láti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ foonu láìsí ìdíyẹlẹ́´. ### English: The patient had been to Nigeria, where some cases of the Ebola virus have occurred. = Yoruba:

column3: A lè rí i pé oníbárà náà ti lọ sí Nàìjíríà, níbi tí àwọn àkóràn àrùn Ebola ti ń wáyé.

column1: English: The PBS show has more than two-dozen Emmy awards, and its run is shorter only than Sesame Street and Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. = Yoruba: Ètò PBS ní tó àmì ẹ̀yẹ Emmy tó lé ní dọ́sìnì méjì, Ó sì ma ń kéré jú òpópónà Sesame àti agbègbè ọ̀gbẹ́ni Rogers lọ. ### English: No immediate reports of damage have been received by the United States Geological Survey (USGS) and its National Earthquake Information Center. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea. = Yoruba: Ní ọarun ọdún sẹ́yìn, àwọn ènìyàn ti kọ́ ilé sí ibi tó lọlẹ́ tí wọ́n tẹ́ dé òké tó súmọ́ òkun. ### English: The major religion in Moldova is Orthodox Christian. = Yoruba:

column1: English: These events normally last anywhere between three and six months, and are held on sites no smaller than 50 hectares. = Yoruba: Ètò yìí kò yẹ kí ó kọjá oṣù mẹta sí mẹ́sàn án ní ibikíbi, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni àwọn ibi tí wọ́n lò kò gbọdọ̀ kéré ju 50 hectares lọ. ### English: Over four million people went to Rome to attend the funeral. = Yoruba:

column1: English: This contradicts earlier reports, which said that cancelling the runoff would have been against the constitution. = Yoruba: Èyí tako àbọ̀ àkọ́kọ́, tí ó sọ pé gbigbégilé àfikun ìbò ìba má ba ìlànà òfin lọ. ### English: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral. = Yoruba:
column2: Amóò, àwọn ètò wọ̀nyí kúròláṣà mọ́jú nígbàtí bíi ajagun 800,000 láti Egbe Ajagun Pupa tì Ìgbìmọ̀ Sofieti wọlé, wọ́n díbọ́n Belarusi àti Yukireni léhin tí wọ́n ṣẹ́gun apá ila òórùn Polandi, ní ìlòdì sí Àdéhùn Àláfíà Riga, Àdéhùn Má-Jàkadì Sofieti-Polandi, pẹ̀lú gbogbo àwọn Àdéhùn ìlúsílù, àti t’oníìlú méjì ati t’oníìlú púpọ̀ si.

column1: English: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. = Yoruba: Oríṣiríṣi èdè french tí wọ́n sọ ní ilé Belgium àti ilú Switzerland yàtọ̀ díẹ̀ sí èdè French tí wọ́n sọ ní France, ṣùgbọ́n wọ jọra. ### English: In the churchyard, there are interesting marble sculptures of doves over some tombs. = Yoruba:

column3: Lakkha Singh fi orin ìyìn sí olúwa hàn. Olórin, Raju Khandelwal, ń bá a lọ.

column1: English: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. column3: Ìyípo pH ni ó hàn nínú iye H (ìjánu H) ìjánu nínú ohun tí a ti ń wo.

column1: English: While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners. = Yoruba: O lè ma gbọ́ pé áwọn ará Grinlandikí se n ló oro náà, o yẹ kí àwọn àjèjì má a sọ́ra fún un. ### English: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany. = Yoruba:

column1: English: No one else has ever made more appearances or scored more goals for the club than Bobek. = Yoruba: Kó sẹ́lòmín tó ṣeré jù tàbí jẹ góòlù jù fún ikọ̀ agbábọ̣̀ọ̀lù ju Bobek. ### English: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area. = Yoruba:
column2: Lati 1966, awon Sundabani ti je ile mimo eranko, won daba pe bii ekun Bengali Oloba 400 ati agbonrin alami 30,00 nlo wa ni agbegbe naa.
column3: Tí ó di ọdún 1966, àwọn agbègbè náà ti di ibi ìgbafẹ́ fún àwọn ẹranko, ó sì jẹ́ pé ó ti jẹ́ pé ó ní 400 àwọn tigre ti Bengal àti 30000 àwọn ẹyẹ tí a ń pè ní spotted deer ní agbègbè náà.

column1: English: Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi. = Yoruba: Agbàlejò tàbí ilé ìtura rẹ (tí o bá ń wà ní ilé ìgbàlejò tàbí ilé ẹnìkan) lè ní wifi tàbí íntánẹ́ẹ̀tì tí wọ́n sopọ̀ mọ́ ẹ̀rọ kọ́mpútà, àti pé gbogbo ilé ìgbàlejò lóní ìyàrá íntánẹ́ẹ̀tì tàbí ibi tóní wifi fún gbogbogbò. ### English: The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called "Manta". = Yoruba:
column2: Àkọ́kọ́ ni ọtí abẹ́léjẹ́. Kìí ṣe ọtí tó le púpọ̀ ṣùgbọ́n ó dùn ó n tunilára. Ọtí abẹ́lé ni wọ́n tún pè ní “Mant.”
column3: Àkọ́kọ́ nínú àwọn ẹ̀yà bẹ́ńjámínì tí ó gbajúmọ̀ jùlọ ni Number One, ó jẹ́ ẹ̀yà bẹ́ńjámínì tí kò ní àbùkù, ó sì dára fún ìtura. Àkọ́kọ́ nínú àwọn ẹ̀yà bẹ́ńjámínì tí ó gbajúmọ̀ ni Manta.

column1: English: For most countries, you will need an offer letter from the institution you wish to study at, and also evidence of funds to support yourself for at least the first year of your course. = Yoruba: Fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ orílẹ̀èdè, wà á nílò lẹ́tà ìfúnni láti ilé ẹ̀kọ́ tí ó wù ọ́ láti kẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ àti ẹ̀rí owó láti se àtìlẹyìn ara rẹ fú ókéré tán ọdún àkọ́kọ̀ ẹ̀kọ́ rẹ. ### English: There are different ways of purifying water, some more effective against specific threats. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. column3: Ó lé ní 60 àwọn àkọsílẹ̀ nípa àwọn ẹ̀rọ iPod tí ó ń gbóná tí ó sì ń fa iná tí ó sì ti fa àwọn iná míràn tí ó sì ti fa àwọn ènìyàn mọ́kànlá ní ẹ̀mí.

column1: English: In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. = Yoruba: Ní àyè àtijọ́, àwọn ọmọ ogun ìjàlọ rìn ní alé wọ́n sí ma dúró láti sùn ní ojú mọmọ. ### English: Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. = Yoruba:

column3: Vatican City ń lo èdè Italian nínú òfin àti ìjùmọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ wọn.

column1: English: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. = Yoruba: Oríṣiríṣi èdè french tí wọ́n sọ ní ilé Belgium àti ilú Switzerland yàtọ̀ díẹ̀ sí èdè French tí wọ́n sọ ní France, ṣùgbọ́n wọ jọra. ### English: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common. = Yoruba:
column2: Montevideo wà ní ilé olóoru; ní àwọn oṣù àkókò eèrùn, ìwọ̀n ooru tó má ń wọ́pọ̀ ni èyí tó ma ń ju +30°C lọ.
column3: Montevideo ni ní apá ìwọ̀ oòrùn; ní àwọn oṣù tí ó ń bọ̀, àwọn àyẹ̀wò tó ju +30°C lọ ni ó ń wáyé.

column1: English: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman. = Yoruba: Phnom Krom, kìlómítà méjìlà gúsù ìwọ ̀oòrun Siem Reap. Ibi Ìjọsìn tí wọ́n kọ́ sí òpin sẹńtúrì kẹsan, nígbàtí Ọba Yasovarman wà ní orí oy. ### English: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future. = Yoruba:
column2: Lẹ́yìn wíwo ìbẹ̀rù àti oríṣìí aburú tí ogun àgbáyé àkọ̀kọ́ fa, gbogbo àgbáyé ti ń gbìyànjú láti yẹra fún irú ìṣẹlẹ̀ aburu bẹ́ẹ̀ ni ọjọ́ iwáj.
column3: Láti rí i pé àwọn ìwà àti àìmọye ìwà ìkà tí ó wáyé ní ogun àgbáyé kìíní ti mú kí àwọn ènìyàn ó máa rò pé kí àwọn ènìyàn ó má ṣe ní irú ìwà àti àìmọye ìwà ìkà bẹ́ẹ̀ mọ́ ní ìgbà míràn.

column1: English: We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. = Yoruba: A ní ìrírí àkókò gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tó ń ṣẹ̀ lẹ́sẹsẹ láti ọjọ́ iwájú wá sí àkókò yìí lọ sẹ́yìn. ### English: Regional and seasonal severe weather phenomena include blizzards, snowstorms, ice storms, and dust storms. = Yoruba:
column2: Agbègbè àti àkókò ojú ọjọ́ tó lágbára nínú èyí ti ìjì líle, yìnyín àti ìji eléruku wà.
column3: Àwọn àìmọ̀ àti àìmọ̀ tó le è gbòde ni ìjì, òjò, ìjì òjò, àti ìjì òjò òjò.

column1: English: In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices. = Yoruba: Láwọn oríléèdè kan, ó kéré tán ilé oúnjẹ orí ìtàkùn ayélujára yóó wà ju àwọn tìbílẹ̀ tó jẹ́ olówó tí kò gunpá lọ. ### English: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. = Yoruba:
column2: Bọ́ọ̀mù ṣiṣẹ́ lóri pé ó gba agbára láti jẹ́ kó wà paps pẹ̀lú nucleus àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ protons àti neutrons.
column3: Ìwòsàn tí a fi ń mú ìyànjú pé ó gba agbára láti mú ìyànjú tí ó ní àìmọye ẹyọ ẹ̀yà ara àti ẹyọ ẹ̀yà ara.

column1: English: Nevertheless, there are many distinctive ways of drinking coffee around the world that are worth experiencing. = Yoruba: Àmọ́sá, ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀nà ọ̀dọ̀ lówà láti fi mún kọfí káàkiri àgbáyé tí o ní láti nírìírí. ### English: The largest tournament of the year takes place in December at the polo fields in Las Cañitas. = Yoruba:
column2: Eré ìje tó tóbi jù lọ́dún ma wáyé nínú oṣù kejì ní pápá ìṣeré polo ní Las Can̂itas.
column3: Àìsàn tó tóbi jùlọ ní ọdún ń wáyé ní oṣù Kẹwàá ní àdúgbò Polo ní Las Cañitas.

column1: English: Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. = Yoruba: A lè ra ohun èlò nígbàkúgbà tí lílò bá kàn án, àmọ́ ọ̀pọ̀ ní kò ní ní ipa púpò tàbí kankan lóri ìsé. ### English: We agree with the USOC's statement that the interests of our athletes and clubs, and their sport, may be better served by moving forward with meaningful change within our organization, rather than decertification. = Yoruba:
column2: A gba ọ̀rọ̀ USOC pé a lẹ̀ sin ànfàní àwọn eléré ìdárayá wa àti àwọn ẹgbe ìdárayá, àti eré ìdárayá wọn tí a bá tẹ̀síwájú pẹ̀lú ayipada tó ní túmọ̀ ní ilé ìṣe wa, ju yiyo ìwé aṣe kuro.
column3: A gbọ́dọ̀ gbọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ USOC tí ó sọ pé àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ àwọn atọ́kùn àti àwọn ẹgbẹ́ wọn, àti ẹ̀kọ́ wọn, le jẹ́ kí a lọ sí ọ̀nà tí ó tọ́ láti mú ìyípadà tó yẹ wá sí USOC, bí kò ṣe kí a fi USOC sílẹ̀.

column1: English: At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge. = Yoruba: Búlọ̀kù ńlá kan bọ́ ní bèbè yínyín, bọ́ sílẹ̀ tàbí fò, ó tilẹ̀ le yí jìnnà sí bèbè. ### English: Voyagers planning sex reassignment surgery abroad must ensure they're carrying valid documents for the return trip. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn arìnrìn àjò tí wọ́n ṣètò láti ṣe sex reassignment surgery ní òkè òkun ma ridájú pé wọ́n mú àwọn ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ tó péye dáni fún àti padà wálé.
column3: Oníyẹ̀ tí ó fẹ́ dènà àyẹ̀wò ìríra ìfarakanra ní òkè òkun gbọ́dọ̀ mú ìwé ìrìnnà tó tó láti padà.

column3: Láti gbogbo National Parks ní South Africa, ni owó ìtanràn àti owó àkópamọ́ díẹ̀díẹ̀ fún ọjà náà.

column1: English: But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built? = Yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n ṣé ìwoṣàkun wa dá lórí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ojú ayé bi? Kí ló dé tí wọ́n ń kọ ilé ìṣọ́ gan an? Báwo ni wọ́n ṣe yà wọ́n, tí wọ́ sì kọ́ wọn? ### English: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979. = Yoruba:
column2: Bi i NSA, ó ran Carter lọ́wọ́ ní yíyanjú Ètò Àgbáyé, bí i Camp David Accords ti ọdún 1978; mímú áyípadà bá àjọsepọ̀ ilẹ̀ US–China ní ọwọ ìparí 1970s; Ìjagbara àwọn ilẹ̀ Iran tí ó yorí sí rògbòdìyàn ìdógo àwọn Iran ní ọdún, 1979; àti yíyalu àwọn Soviet ní Afghanistan ní ọdún 1979.
column3: Lọ́dún 1978, ó ti Carter ní ìmọ̀ràn lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ìṣèlú ayé, bí i àwọn àyípadà ti Camp David, ọdún 1978; ó tún ti Carter ní ìmọ̀ràn lórí bí wọ́n ṣe lè mú ọ̀rọ̀ ìṣèlú US àti China padà sí bó ṣe wà ní ìgbà ìgbàgbé, ní ọdún 1970; ó tún ti Carter ní ìmọ̀ràn lórí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ Iran, tí ó mú kí wọ́n ní ìkọlù àwọn ọmọ ogun ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà ní Iran, ọdún 1979; àti ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí Soviet ṣe sí ilẹ̀ Afíríkà, ọdún 1979. column1: English: The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. = Yoruba: Ohun tí ó se pàtàkì jù nínú èrò yìí ni : ìdáhùn ẹyọ̀kan ṣoṣo ni ó tọ̀na. Ìsáhùn méjì péré ni yíò wá sọ́kàn rẹ, èyí náà ni, èyí tó tọ̀nà tàbí èyí tí kò tọ̀nà. ### English: Prime Minister Stephen Harper has agreed to send the government's 'Clean Air Act' to an all-party committee for review, before its second reading, after Tuesday's 25 minute meeting with NDP leader Jack Layton at the PMO. = Yoruba:
column2: Adari ijọba Stephen Harper ti gba lati fi iwe erongba ijọba lori “Clean Air Act” ranṣẹ si ijoko awon ọmọ ẹgbẹ fun agbeyẹwo, ki oto di kika fun igba elekeji lọyin ipade ọjọ iṣẹgun oni iṣẹju mẹẹdọgbọn pẹlu adari NDP Jack Layton ni PMO.
column3: Ààrẹ-Ààrẹ Stephen Harper ti gba àyẹ̀wò àbájáde òfin 'Àríwá Àti-Òfin' ti ìjọba láti ọ̀dọ̀ àyẹ̀wò àbájáde gbogbo-party, kí ó tó di àkọ́kọ́, lẹ́yìn àyẹ̀wò 25 ìṣẹ́jú ní ilé-ẹjọ́ PMO ní ọjọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun.

column1: English: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion offering kayaking, hiking, shops, restaurants, and more. = Yoruba: Irukusu Boweni jẹ gbajumo ìrìn àjò ọjọ́ kan tàbí ìparí ọ̀sẹ̀, to pèsè kayaki, irin, ọjà, ilé ounje àti púpọ̀ si. ### English: South Africa have defeated the All Blacks (New Zealand) in a rugby union Tri Nations match at the Royal Bafokeng Stadium in Rustenburg, South Africa. = Yoruba:
column2: Ilẹ̀ South Africa ti sẹ́gun àwọn aláwọ̀ dúdú gbogbo (New Zealand) nínú ẹgbẹ́ rugby orílẹ̀ mẹ́ta ní pápá ìseré Royal Bafokeng nílẹ̀ Rustenburg nilẹ̀ South Africa.
column3: Aṣàlẹ̀ Afirika ti gba ife ẹyẹ Rugby Union Tri Nations ni Royal Bafokeng Stadium ni Rustenburg, South Africa.

column3: Èyí kì í ṣe àárẹ̀. Èyí ni ìparí ojú ìwé kan àti ṣíṣí ojú ìwé tuntun.

column1: English: Born in Hong Kong, Ma studied at New York University and Harvard Law School and once held an American permanent resident "green card". = Yoruba: A bi ni Hong Kong. Ma kẹkọ ni ile iwe giga New York ati ile ẹkọ imọ ofin Harvard bẹẹni o si fi igba kan ni iwe igbelu Ameria “kaadi alawọ ewe”. ### English: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him. = Yoruba:
column2: Ní ọjọ́ Ajé, Sara Danius, akọ̀wé àgbà ti ẹgbẹ́ Nobel fún ìtàn àròsọ ní ilé ẹ̀ka Swedin, tí wọ́n kéde ní ètò kan lóri rẹ́díò lóri rẹ́díò Svergies ní Sweden, àwọn ẹgbk kò lè dé ọ̀dọ̀ BobDylan nípa bíborí ní 2016 Nobel Prize Literature, ó ti rẹ̀ wọ́n láti kàn si.
column3: Lọjọ Aje, Sara Danius, aṣoju ẹka ile ẹjọ fun imọ ofin Nobel Committee for Literature ni ile ẹjọ giga Swedish Academy, ni ẹkunrẹrẹ ẹrọ iroyin ni ile ẹjọ giga Sveriges Radio ni Sweden, ṣalaye pe ile ẹjọ, ko le gba Bob Dylan ni imọran lati gba ẹbun Nobel Prize in Literature ni ọdun 2016, ko le gba imọran lati gba ẹbun naa.

column1: English: Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. column1: English: The translation engines have improved dramatically, and now often give more or less correct translations (and more seldom gibberish), but some care is due, as they still may have gotten it all wrong. = Yoruba: Àwọn èrọ atúmò èdè ti dárasi láìsí ánì-àní, pèlú níbàyí o ń fi ìtumọ̀ èdè dárá ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà (àti ìwòmba àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ díẹ̀ tí kò ní ìtumọ̀), sùgbọ́n àwọn àyẹ̀wò díẹ̀ se pàtakì nítorí wọ́n lè gbe gbági. ### English: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. column1: English: Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. column1: English: Anyone interested in seeing evidence of the damage to the mummy done during attempts to remove it from the coffin will be disappointed as only the head and shoulders are visible. = Yoruba: Ẹni tí ó bá wù láti rí èrí ìpalára sí mummy ni ìgbà tí wọ́n ń gbìyànjú láti yọ ọ́ kúrò ní inú pósí, yóò banújẹ́, nítorí orí àti èjìká ni ó ṣe é rí. ### English: The capital of Moldova is Chişinău. column3: Ilé-Ifẹ̀ ni olú-ìlú Moldova. Ìlú náà ni wọ́n ń sọ èdè Romanian, ṣùgbọ́n èdè Russian ni wọ́n ń sọ jùlọ.

column1: English: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. = Yoruba: Ní nǹkan bí i osù kẹwàá ọdọọdún ni àwọn ẹranko tó ń jẹ ewé tíye wọ́n tó mílíọ̀nù kan ó lé ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta ma ń rìnrìn àjò lọ sí ẹkùn gúúsù, fo odò Mara láti àwọn òkè àríwá fún òjò. ### English: The work done was mostly theoretical, but the program was written to simulate observations made of the Sagittarius galaxy. = Yoruba:

column1: English: If traveling in a developing country for the first time – or in a new part of the world – don't underestimate the potential culture shock. = Yoruba: Tí rínrin ìrìn àjò sí ìlú tóní ìdàgbàsóké fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tàbí kí o wà ní apá ibì kan tuntun ní àgbáyé-- má mú àṣà náà kéré. ### English: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment. = Yoruba:

column1: English: While immigration check is usually absent or a formality when you arrive in your homeland, customs control can be a hassle. = Yoruba: Níbóse jẹ́ wípé àyẹ̀wò ìṣíkiri kì í sábàá sí tàbí tí kò ra jaja, bí o bá dé ilú rẹ, ìsàkóso àwọn asọ́bodè lè di wàhálà. ### English: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. = Yoruba: Àwọn ọkọ̀ orí omi tó ń rin odò Galapagos – wà láti ìwọ̀n elérò mẹ́jọ sí ọgọ́rùn-ún. ### English: Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Argentine Theatre, the same location she used to start her 2005 campaign for the Senate as member of the Buenos Aires province delegation. = Yoruba:
column2: Arábìnrin Kirchner kéde èróngbà láti díje dunpò ààrẹ ilé ìseré ìtàgé Argentine, ibùdó kanáà tí ó lò fún ìpolongo rẹ̀ fún ìdìbò asòfin gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ aṣojú ẹkùn Buenos Aires.
column3: Ààrẹ Kirchner kéde pé òun fẹ́ ṣe ààrẹ ní ilé-ìwé tí ó ń jẹ́ Argentine Theatre, ilé-ìwé náà ni ó ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìpolongo rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí aṣojú fún agbègbè Buenos Aires ní ọdún 2005.

column1: English: The game is based on the Second Battle of Fallujah, a vicious battle between American and Iraqi forces. = Yoruba: Eré náà dá lórí ìjà Fallujah ìkejì, ìjà kíkan láàrín àwọn ọmọ ogun Amerika àti Iraaki. ### English: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Mr. Rudd's decision to sign the Kyoto climate accord isolates the United States, which will now be the only developed nation not to ratify the agreement. = Yoruba: Ìpinnú ọ̀gbẹ́ni Rudd láti buwọ́lú ojú ọjọ́ Kyoto yọ orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹríka sílẹ̀, tí yóò sì wá di orílẹ́ èdè kan ṣoṣo ní àgbáyé tí ó dàgbà tí kò sì wá́ àtúnṣe sí àjùmọ̀gbà. ### English: The willingness of governments to issue passports with gender not stated (X) or documents updated to match a desired name and gender varies. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìmúrasílè àwọn ìjọba láti fàyè gba ìwẹ́ ìrinnà tí kò sàfihàn bóyá akọ yálà abo (X) tàbí àwọn ìwẹ isẹ́ tó pójúòsùwòn ní ìbámu pèlú orúko àti takọ-tabo yàtọ̀.
column3: Ìsọ̀rí ìjọba láti bù fún ara wọn ní ìwé ẹ̀rí tí kò ní àkọsílẹ̀ ẹ̀yà (X) tàbí ìwé ẹ̀rí tí a ti bù fún ara wọn sí orúkọ àti ẹ̀yà tí a fẹ́ràn ti ń jẹ́ kí ó yàtọ̀.

column1: English: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World. = Yoruba: Láti ìgbà tí wọ́n dáa sílẹ̀ Alubosa ti di ìròyìn ẹlẹ́fẹ́ tó dáju, pẹ̀lú ìtẹ̀jáde, saiti to fa ojú alejò 5,000,000 ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ ní Owara, ipolowo tara eni, ilé iṢẹ́ ìròyìn tò ṢiṢe fún wákàtí 24, Podkasti, àti ìwé ìmọ̀ ayé - Atlasi ti a Ṣẹ̀ tún gbéjáde tí apé ni “Aye wa tí ò ní Làakáyè”. ### English: In late 2015, TogiNet established AstroNet Radio as a subsidiary station. = Yoruba:

column1: English: With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as "Hawaii down under". = Yoruba: Pẹ̀lú lílo àkókò kanáà pẹ̀lú Hawaii, àwọn erékùsù ma ń ro Hawaii gẹ́gẹ́ bí “Hawaii tó wà lábẹ́”. ### English: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. = Yoruba:

column1: English: This is something you always need to keep in mind, to avoid disappointment or perhaps even distaste over local ways to do things. = Yoruba: Ohùn kan wà tí o ní láti má a fi sọ́kàn nígbàgbogbo, láti yàgò fún ìjákulẹ̀ tàbí yẹra fún àwọn ọ̀nà àìda tìbílẹ̀ ti wọ́n fi ń se nǹkan. ### English: The strain of bird flu lethal to humans, H5N1, has been confirmed to have infected a dead wild duck, found on Monday, in marshland near Lyon in the east of France. = Yoruba:

column1: English: "Panama Papers" is an umbrella term for roughly ten million documents from Panamanian law firm Mossack Fonseca, leaked to the press in spring 2016. = Yoruba: “Pépà Panama” jẹ́ bí àkójọ ọ̀rọ̀ fún àwọn ìwé mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá láti iléeṣẹ́ òfin Panama Mossack Fonseca, èyí tó hàn de fáwọn oníròyìn lọ́dun 2016. ### English: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing. = Yoruba:
column2: Ẹkun ti Chaco jẹ ile fun ọpọlọpọ ẹgbẹ awọn ẹya abinibi bi Guaycurú ati Payaguá, ti o jẹ iṣẹ ọdẹ ṣiṣe ati ẹja pipa ni won yan laayo.
column3: Ìpínlẹ̀ Chaco jẹ́ ibi tí àwọn ẹ̀yà abínibí mìíràn ti ń gbé, bíi Guaycurú àti Payaguá, tí wọ́n ń gbé níbẹ̀ pẹ̀lú iṣẹ́ àgbẹ̀, tí wọ́n sì ń jẹun àti mu omi.

column1: English: One of strong points of Charlotte, North Carolina, is that it has an abundance of high-quality options for families. = Yoruba: Àmì kan gbòógì tí ìlú Charlotte ní ẹkùn àríwá Carolina ni wípé ó ní àǹfàní ìgbé ayé tó pójú owó fáwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí. ### English: Downhill skiing as a sport goes back to at least the 17th century, and in 1861 the first recreational ski club was opened by Norwegians in Australia. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification. = Yoruba: Láti darapọ̀ mọ́ irú àkójọ bí èyí, o kàn nílò láti buwọlu fọ́ọ̀mù lórí ìtàkùn ayélujára; lóòótọ́, irú àkójọ yìí nílò àyẹ̀wò míràn. ### English: The Report opens with plea for open debate and the formation of a consensus in the United States about the policy towards the Middle East. = Yoruba:

column3: A fi ọ̀rọ̀ náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àyẹ̀wò ìfọ̀rọ̀wọ́rọ̀ àti ìpolongo ìpolongo ní ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà nípa ètò ìṣèlú sí ilẹ̀ Mẹ́ṣíkò.

column1: English: Pittman suggested that conditions wouldn't improve until sometime next week. = Yoruba: Pittman dámọ̀ràn àtúnse ò ní wáyé bí kò di ọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀. ### English: While this is often only an inaccurate stereotype, the best way to get along in Paris still is to be on your best behavior, acting like someone who is "bien élevé" (well brought up). It will make getting about considerably easier. = Yoruba:
column2: Níwọ̀n ìgbà tí èyí kìí se ìwòye tó se déédéé ní gbogbo ìgbà, ọ̀nà tó dára jùlọ láti sẹ dáradára ní Paris ni láti jé ọmọlúwàbí ní ìhùwàsí bí ẹni tó gbẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ ilé. Èyí máa jẹ kí lílọ káàkiri seése ní ìrọrùn.
column3: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé èyí ni àbùkù àìmọ̀, ọ̀nà tó dára jùlọ láti gbé ní Paris ni pé kí o máa ṣe bí ẹni tí ó "bíi ti àwojú" (ó ní àwojú). Ó máa mú kí o lè gbé níbẹ̀ láì ní ìpalára.

column1: English: Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms! = Yoruba: Àwọn ìwọn iná tún kéré ju àwọn n´ kan tó kórajọ di àwọn ìwọn nkan tó gba àyè tó kéré jùlọ. ### English: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìgbà òtútù le fẹ́ tutù alárúmọjẹ, àwọn ìwọ̀n òtútù ki sábà kẹ́rẹ́ sí dídì sùgbọ́n afẹ́fẹ́ áti ọ̀rìn nínú òtútù màa ǹ papọ̀ láti mú dàbí pẹ́ ó tutù ju bí èrọ ìgbóná tí se wọ̀n lọ.
column3: Ìwọ̀n òṣùpá lè jẹ́ àìmọ̀: Ìwọ̀n òṣùpá kò lè lọ búrurú ní òwúrọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n òṣùpá àti àìmọ̀ lè jọ jọ láti mú kí òwúrọ̀ ó ṣe búrurú ju ohun tí ìwọ̀n òṣùpá sọ.

column1: English: Until now, AOL has been able to move and develop the IM market at its own pace, due to its widespread use within the United States. = Yoruba: Títí di ìsín AOL tilè mú ìdàgbàsókè àti ìtẹ̀síwájú ọjà IM wáyé ní iwọnsí tiẹ̀, ní torípé ilò rẹ̀ kári gbogbo Ìlú Amerika. ### English: You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride. = Yoruba:
column2: O lè lo boda boda (tákisí ọks alùpùpù) láti rìn kiri Goma. Iye rẹ̀ gangan ni 500 Congolese France fún ìrìn àjò kékeré náà.
column3: O le è lo oja-omi (okada) lati gba ibẹrẹ Goma. Iye owo ori (oju-omi) ti o yẹ ni ~500 Congolese Francs fun idije ti o pọju.

column1: English: Accompanied by those officials, he assured Texas citizens that steps were being taken to protect the public's safety. = Yoruba: Pelu awon osise naa, o da awon olugbe Tegsasi loju pe won ti n gbe awon igbese lati daabo bo ailewu awujo eda. ### English: Potro received treatment to his shoulder at this point but managed to return to the game. = Yoruba:
