column3: Potro ni o gba itan ile-ise yii, o si tun gba siwaju si ipele ikolu, sugbon o si tun gba siwaju si ipele ikolu.

column1: English: If using a drone, check well in advance as to what you are allowed to film and what permits or additional licensing are required. = Yoruba: Ti o ba n lo drooni, ṣaridaju nkan ti wọn gba ẹ laye lati yaworan rẹ ati awọn iwe aṣẹ ti o ye ki o gba. ### English: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. = Yoruba:
column2: Ti o ba pe eniti o jina si o pelu egberun maili, ero ayelujara lo n lo.
column3: Oun to ba n lo ẹrọ amohunmaworan lati fi ṣọwọ si ẹni ti o n gbe ni ẹgbàamọta miliọnu miliọnu ẹsẹ̀, o n lo ẹrọ amohunmaworan ti o n gbe ni ẹgbàamọta miliọnu miliọnu ẹsẹ̀.

column1: English: Registration is an additional requirement for the visa process. In some countries, you must register your presence and address where you are staying with the local authorities. = Yoruba: Ìforúkọsílẹ̀ jẹ́ àfikún tí a nílò fún ìṣètò visa. Ní àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè kànkan, o ní láti forúkọsílẹ̀ fún wíwá rẹ àti àdírẹ́sì ibi tí ò ń gbé fún àwọn tó wà ní ipò àṣẹ sílẹ̀. ### English: The final score was a one-point victory, 21 to 20, ending the All Blacks' 15 game winning streak. = Yoruba:
column2: Esi asekagba je ti ibori pelu ayo kan don do, mokanlelogun si ogun, to o fi opin si aifi-idiremi meedogun lera-lera ti All Blacks’.
column3: Ìkókó tí ó gbẹ̀yìn jẹ́ àádọ́ta sí mẹ́wàá, èyí tí ó mú kí àádọ́ta tí ó ti wà fún ọdún mẹ́wàá yípadà.

column1: English: Vautier's achievements outside of directing include a hunger strike in 1973 against what he viewed as political censorship. = Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ ise takun takun ni ṣíṣe olùdarí, ara àwọn ohun tí Fọ́tíyà gbéṣe ni ìdájíjẹsílẹ̀ ní ọdún 1973 láti takò nkan tí ó jọmọ́ ìpanilẹ́numọ́ ti òṣèl. ### English: Huhne has resigned and he will be replaced in the Cabinet by Ed Davey MP. Norman Lamb MP is expected to take the Business Minister job Davey is vacating. = Yoruba:
column2: Hune ti fiwe sile, won de ma fi Ed Dafe MP ropo e ni Igbimo. Nomani Lab MP ni a n reti pe o ma gba ise Minista Isowo ti Dafe ma fi sile.
column3: Ó ti fi ipò sílẹ̀, ó sì ti di ààrẹ fún Ed Davey MP. Norman Lamb MP ni ó ti gba ipò Ed Davey tí ó ti fi sílẹ̀.

column1: English: Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. = Yoruba: Jẹmaní pẹ ìnajíjẹ́ àwọn ìkolù náà ní “Isẹ́ Sealion”. Ọmọ ogun IÌú Gẹ̀ẹ́si ti pàdánù ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ohun ìjà àti ìpẹ̀sẹ̀ ikan ogun rẹ nígbàtí o kójádẹo kúrò ní Dunkirk, fún ìdí èyí, ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun náà ti di alàílágbára. ### English: The satellites, both of which weighed in excess of 1,000 pounds, and traveling at approximately 17,500 miles per hour, collided 491 miles above the Earth. = Yoruba:
column2: Sátẹ̀láìtì náà, méjèjì tó wọ́n ju 1000 pounds lọ,tí wọ́n s;i rin ìrìn àjò tó tó máàlì 17,500 ní wákàtí,kọlu máàlì 491 lórí ilẹ̀.
column3: Àwọn ẹ̀rọ-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ náà, tí wọ́n jẹ́ ti tó 1,000 pound, tí wọ́n ń lọ ní àádọ́ta, ó lé ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta mítà ní ìhà tí ó ga jùlọ ní ilẹ̀ ayé, ti gbógun ti ara wọn ní àádọ́ta mítà ní ìhà tí ó ga jùlọ ní ilẹ̀ ayé.

column1: English: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. = Yoruba: Ní nǹkan bí i osù kẹwàá ọdọọdún ni àwọn ẹranko tó ń jẹ ewé tíye wọ́n tó mílíọ̀nù kan ó lé ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta ma ń rìnrìn àjò lọ sí ẹkùn gúúsù, fo odò Mara láti àwọn òkè àríwá fún òjò. ### English: In 1956 Słania moved to Sweden, where three years later he began work for the Swedish Post Office and became their chief engraver. = Yoruba:
column2: Ní ọdún 1956, Slania kó lọ sí Sweden, níbití ó ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ fún ilé iṣẹ́ ìfìwéránṣẹ́ Sweden lẹ́yìn ọdún mẹ́ta tó sì di olórí ayàwòrán.
column3: Odún 1956 ni Słania lọ sí Swídìn, tí ó sì di ọdún 1959 tí ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ fún Swedish Post Office, ó sì di olóòtú wọn.

column1: English: So if you were standing by the shoreline, you would be able to see down to whatever pebbles or gunk that was on the bottom. = Yoruba: Nítorínà bí o bá dúró lẹ́bàá òkun, wà á lè rí ìsàlẹ̀ rí òkúta tàbí ìdọ̀tí tó wà nísàlẹ̀. ### English: At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic. = Yoruba:
column2: Ní apá kan ní idìbo ìdámẹ́wa 29 ló wà àwọn ìwádí gbagbo wipe Ọstrelia mato di ripobiliki n gẹ́lẹ́ ti o ṢeéṢe idamewa 31 wipe kí Ostrelia ma di ripobiliki rara.
column3: Ní apá gúúsù ìpolówó, 29 nínú 100 àwọn tí a fètò sí pé Australia gbọdọ̀ di orílẹ̀-èdè olómìnira lásìkò yìí, 31 nínú 100 àwọn tí a fètò pé Australia kò gbọdọ̀ di orílẹ̀-èdè olómìnira.

column1: English: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. = Yoruba: Sísẹ àwárí kèké sọ kèké ogun Assiria di fífúyé, oníjàfáfá, àti dáradára láti sárẹ́ kọja jagunjagun àti kèké ogun míràn. ### English: I don't know if you realize it or not, but most of the goods from Central America came into this country duty-free. = Yoruba:

column3: Kò mọ̀ bóyá o mọ tàbí kò mọ, ṣùgbọ́n ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọjà láti Amẹ́ríkà Kọ̀mpútà ló wọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láì san owó orí.

column1: English: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. = Yoruba: Orílẹ̀èdè England ti ní ìrírí àlàáfíà ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́ lẹ́yìn ìṣẹ́gun ilẹ̀ Danelaw. ### English: Local authorities are warning residents in the vicinity of the plant to stay indoors, turn off air-conditioners and not to drink tap water. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn aláṣẹ abẹ́lé ti ń sèkìlọ̀ fáwọn òsìṣẹ́ lágbègbè iléeṣẹ́ láti dúró sílé, pa ẹ̀rọ amúnlétutù, kí wọ́n má sì mú omi ẹ̀rọ.
column3: Ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ ń kéde fún àwọn olùgbé inú agbègbè náà láti máa gbé inú ilé, kí wọ́n sì mú àwọn àfojúrí afẹ́fẹ́ wọn kúrò, kí wọ́n má sì mu omi tí wọ́n ń mu láti inú àwọn àfonífojì.

column1: English: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). = Yoruba: Drukgyal Dzong jẹ́ odi tí ó ti bàjẹ́ àti iléègbé àwọn mọ́ǹkì Buddhist ní òkè agbègbè Para (ní abúlé Phondey. ### English: No major damage or injuries have been reported in Tonga, but power was temporarily lost, which reportedly prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning issued by the PTWC. = Yoruba:
column2: Wọn ò jésì ìpalára tàbí ìjàmba púpọ̀jù ní Tonga, ṣùgbọ́n iná ṣẹ́jú fún ìgbà kan, tó mú kí àwọn aláṣẹ Tonga má rí ìkilọ̀ ìjì súnámì tí PWC gbéjáde.
column3: Kò sí àìmọye ààrùn tàbí àìmọye ìrora tó ti wáyé ní Tógò, ṣùgbọ́n iná ti jẹ́ kí ìjọba Tógò ó má lè gba ìkìlọ̀ olóró tí PTWC fi ránṣẹ́ sí wọn.

column1: English: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as "King Tut" or "The Boy King", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. = Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni! Ọba Tutankhamun, ti wọ́n fi ìgbà kan pè ní “King Tut” tàbí “ọba àwọn ọkùnrin”, jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ọba Egypt àtijọ́ tí ó gbajúmọ̀ ní ayé òdi òní. ### English: The photographers later took the place of an aged lady as she needed the lavatory. Mendoza was gunned down. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn olùyàwòrán padà gba ipò obìnrin arúgbó kan nítorí ó lọ́ sí ilé ìtúnraṣe. Wọ́n yín Mendoza níbọn pa.
column3: Awọn oniṣowo náà wá gba ipò obìnrin àgbà kan, nítorí pé ó nílò ilé ìwòsàn. Ọmọdé Mendoza náà ti kú.

column1: English: Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. = Yoruba: Kódá dídúró láàrin ìparun ẹgbẹ̀rún ọdún, ó rọrùn láti fi ìró àti òórùn ogun ọjọ́ pípẹ̀ sọ́kàn, débí gbígbọ́ gbùgbùgbù ẹsẹ ẹranko lórí òkúta àti gbígbọ́ òórùn ẹ̀rù tó jáde látinú ọ̀gbun. ### English: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious." = Yoruba:
column2: Lọ́sẹ̀ tó kọjá, METI kéde pé iléeṣẹ́ Apple ti fi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìgbónájù mẹ́rìnlélọ́gbọ̀n tó òhun léti, èyí tí iléeṣẹ́ pè ní “àìkójú-òsùwọ̀n.”
column3: Iṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀, METI ti fi hàn pé Apple ti fi hàn wọ́n pé wọ́n ti rí 34 ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àyẹ̀wò tó ti di kòkòrò, tí Apple ń pè ní "kòkòrò tí kò léwu".

column1: English: In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking. = Yoruba: Má a gbádùn àwọn eréje ìfò inú yìnyín tó dára jù nígbà òtútù ní ẹkùn àríwá America, àti wíwa alupùpù lórí àpáta to gbámúsé jù lákòókò ooru. ### English: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse = Yoruba:
column2: Níwọ̀n ìgbà ti àwọn oúnjẹ wọn kò sàjòjì sí wa, àwọnn arà Romu náà ní àwọn àsè tó sàjòjì tàbí tí kò wọ́pọ̀, bi akọ ẹlẹ́dẹ̀, àkùkọ, ìgbín, àti ẹ̀dà eku tí a ń pè ní dormouse.
column3: Kò sí ohun tí wọn fi jẹun tí a mọ̀, àwọn ará Roma ní àwọn ohun tí wọn fi jẹun tí ó jọra wọn, bí i: ẹfọ̀n, ẹyẹ, ìkookò àti àwọn ẹyẹ tí a mọ̀ sí ẹyẹ tí ó ń gbé inú àpáta.

column1: English: Last week, Naked News announced that it would dramatically increase its international language mandate to news reporting, with three new broadcasts. = Yoruba: Ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá, ìròyìn Naked News kéde pé òun yó málèkún bá èdè àgbéyé fún ìjábọ̀ ìròyìn pẹ̀lú ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ mẹ́ta tuntun. ### English: When you went abroad at first, people were probably patient and understanding, knowing that travellers in a new country need to adapt. = Yoruba:

column3: Tí o bá lọ sí òkè-òkun ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀, ènìyàn lè jẹ́ onígboyà àti aláàánú, ó sì mọ pé àwọn tí ó ń gbé ní ilẹ̀ tí wọ́n ti ń bọ̀ ni wọ́n nílò láti dènà àyípadà.

column1: English: Bird flu, or more formally avian influenza, can infect both birds and mammals. = Yoruba: Lùkúlùkú tàbí àjàkálẹ̀ kòkòrò lè mún àwọn ẹyẹ àti ẹranko onírun. ### English: In one year's time, an infected person may infect 10 to 15 close contacts. = Yoruba:

column1: English: This fully feathered, warm blooded bird of prey was believed to have walked upright on two legs with claws like the Velociraptor. = Yoruba: Won gbagbo pe eye apaje yi to ni iye nigbogbo ara to si je alara gbigbona, ma n ri lori ese mejeje pelu eekana bii ti Felosirapito. ### English: Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes. = Yoruba:
column2: Bí àwọn àkọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́, ó ṣiyèméjì bóyá àrùn ìtọ ṣúgá lè ní ìwòsàn, tí ó sì mọ̀ pé kò wúlò fún àwọn tó bá ní àrùn ìtọ ṣúgá Type 1.
column3: O ni ki won pe fun awon onise miran pe, ko si ohun ti o le se fun awon to ti ni aisan ti o je ti Type 1 diabetes, nitori pe, o seese ko ni se fun won.

column1: English: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green. = Yoruba: Orí koróko ni wọ́n tí ń se eré náà, àti pé wọ́n má ń gé koríko tó wà ní ẹ̀bá ihò kúrú èyí tí wọ́n ń pè ní àwọ̀ ewéko. ### English: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa. = Yoruba:

column3: Tí ó fi mọ́ Montevideo, ó wà ní ìlà Oòrùn Equator, ó sì jẹ́ pé nígbà tí ó jẹ́ òru ní ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà, ó jẹ́ òru níbẹ̀, àti pé nígbà tí ó jẹ́ òru ní ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà, ó jẹ́ òru níbẹ̀.

column1: English: Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail. = Yoruba: Wọn tó òkúta s’ẹ́gbẹ́ púpọ̀ ojú ọ̀nà náà àti pé níbi tó gajù okùn onírin pèsè réèlì ọwọ́ fún àtìlẹ́yìn. ### English: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I = Yoruba:
column2: Fún ẹgbẹgbẹ̀rùn ọdún sẹ́yìn ẹ̀sì krìstíẹ́nì tí so àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè Europe papọ̀ pẹ̀lú èdè àti àṣa wọn tó yàtọ̀.
column3: Bí ó ti lẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ẹ̀sìn kírísítì ti ń mú àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè ilẹ̀ Europe ó wà ní ìta fún ìgbà pípẹ́, ó sì ń mú wọn gbára dì láti mú ìyàtọ̀ tí ó wà nínú èdè àti ìṣe wọn.

column1: English: The comments, live on television, were the first time that senior Iranian sources have admitted that the sanctions are having any effect. = Yoruba: Ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún lórí ètò amóhùnmáwòrán, ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí abẹnugan àgbà ilẹ̀ Iran kan gbà pé ìbáwí tí wọn fi léde ní ip. ### English: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed. = Yoruba:

column3: Àwọn ẹranko inú ọgbà náà ti rí ènìyàn ní ìgbà pípẹ́, ṣùgbọ́n wọn kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ mọ ènìyàn, wọ́n sì yẹ kí wọ́n má jẹun tàbí kí wọ́n jẹ́ kí ènìyàn ba wọn jẹ́.

column1: English: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way of circumventing both political censorship and commercial IP-geofiltering. = Yoruba: Àwọn olùpèsè VPN (ìtàkùn aláfojúrí ọlọ́danni) jẹ́ ọ̀nà kan tó dára jùlọ láti wá ọ̀nà àbáyọ sáwọn ọ̀rọ̀ òṣèlú tí a fi pamọ́ àti dídí ìdúrógbaari okoòwò. ### English: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. = Yoruba:
column2: Britain ma ń wa omi òkun tí àwọn ọka ojú omi ma ń gbà kọjá láti má jẹ́ kí èyíkèyí okọ̀ ojú omi wo gbogbo abala òkun náà, tó ma fa ewu fún àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú omi tí kò mọ ǹkankan.
column3: Britain fi àwọn agbègbè ilẹ̀ tí ó wà ní àyíká ilẹ̀ ayé ṣókùnkùn láti dènà gbogbo àwọn ọkọ̀ láti wọ inú àwọn agbègbè ilẹ̀ tí ó wà ní àyíká ilẹ̀ ayé, èyí tí ó mú kí àwọn ọkọ̀ tí kò bá jẹ́ ti ìjọba ó di ewu.

column1: English: The trial took place at Birmingham Crown Court and concluded on August 3. = Yoruba: Ìgbẹ́jọ́ wáyé ní ilé ẹjọ́ Birmingham Crown ó sì parí ní ọjọ́ kẹta osù kẹjọ. ### English: Plants look their best when in a natural environment, so resist the temptation to remove even "just one" specimen. = Yoruba:

column1: English: Scientists have discovered landforms littered across the moon's surface called lobate scarps that have apparently resulted from the moon's shrinking very slowly. = Yoruba: Àwọn onímò-ìjìnlẹ ti sàwárí àwọn ibi òkè ohun ìpètélè ti o fónká kiri ojú òsùpá ti a n pẹ ni lobate scarps èyí ni àyọrìsí mímú òsùpá súnrakí ní díè díè. ### English: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses. = Yoruba:
column2: O je ibanuje pe ona titun lati fikowe ti jade, pensu ti jabo si ipo kekere ati ilo kekere.
column3: Ànímọ̀-ọwọ́, bí àwọn ọ̀nà míràn ti a n kọ ti ṣe ń yọjú, ohun ìpètélè ti a n pẹ ti di ohun tí ó kéré jùlọ àti ohun tí a n lò.

column1: English: Stardust will set a new all-time record for being the fastest spacecraft to return to Earth, breaking the previous record set in May of 1969 during the return of the Apollo X command module. = Yoruba: Stardust yíò gbé àkọsílẹ̀ tí ó ga jùlọ kalẹ̀ pẹ̀lú bí ó se ba àkọ́sílẹ̀ ti oṣù karùn ún ọdún 1969 jẹ́ ní àkókò ìpadàbọ̀ Apollo X. ### English: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology. = Yoruba:
column2: Àwọn oìwoye tí wọ́n gbà lórí ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ sáyẹ̀nsì àti ìmọ̀ ọpọlọ ni ìwòye Aristotle.

column1: English: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. = Yoruba: Tẹ́ḿpìlì Artemis ní Éfésù di pípa run ní Oṣù Keje, ọdún 356 BCE ìjàmbá iná tí Herostratus dá silesílè. ### English: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. = Yoruba:
column2: Tiọ́rì àkóónú dá lórí ìwádí ohun tí ó mú àwọn èèyàn yigbì tàbí dùnmọ́ wọn.
column3: Ìtumọ̀-ìmọ̀ nípa ohun tí ó ń mú ènìyàn tẹ́lẹ̀ tàbí ohun tí ó ń ṣe é tẹ́lẹ̀.

column1: English: Felicia, once a Category 4 storm on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale, weakened to a tropical depression before dissipating Tuesday. = Yoruba: Felisia, to fi ìgbà kan jẹ ìjì to wà lórí Abala 4 ní Ojú Ìwọ̀n Ìjì Nla ti Saffir-Simpson, rẹlẹ̀ sí ìjì nla ti ọ̀nà òòorùn kí o to papà fónká ní Ọjọ́ Ìségun. ### English: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive. = Yoruba:
column2: A kọ́ àwọn ilé wa pẹ̀lú ewé a sì ṣe àwọn aṣọ wá nínu ewé náà. Púpọ̀ nínú àwọn óúnjẹ́ tí à ń jẹ jẹ́ ewé. Láìsí ewé, àwọn ẹranko kò lè yè.
column3: A wa ni ilé wa láti orí igi, a sì ń fi orí igi ṣe aṣọ wa. Àwọn ohun tí a ń jẹ lójoojúmọ́ ni a fi igi ṣe. Kí a má ba ní igi, àwọn ẹranko kò ní lè gbé.

column1: English: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. = Yoruba: Oríṣiríṣi èdè french tí wọ́n sọ ní ilé Belgium àti ilú Switzerland yàtọ̀ díẹ̀ sí èdè French tí wọ́n sọ ní France, ṣùgbọ́n wọ jọra. ### English: The final match of the series will take place at Ellis Park in Johannesburg next week, when the Springboks play Australia. = Yoruba:
column2: ifesewonse asekagba eto yio waye ni Papa isere Ellis ni Ilu johannesburg ni ose tin b, nigba ti Springboks gba pelu Australi.
column3: Ìdíje tí ó gbẹ̀yìn nínú ètò yìí yóò wáyé ní Ellis Park ní Johannesburg lọ́jọ́ iwájú, nígbà tí Springboks bá Australia jà.

column1: English: Last week, Naked News announced that it would dramatically increase its international language mandate to news reporting, with three new broadcasts. = Yoruba: Ní ọ̀sẹ̀ tó kọjá, ìròyìn Naked News kéde pé òun yó málèkún bá èdè àgbéyé fún ìjábọ̀ ìròyìn pẹ̀lú ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ mẹ́ta tuntun. ### English: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. = Yoruba:
column2: Ìkan lára awọn ìlànà tí a n lò láti fi júwe bí ìdarapọ̀ ṣe ṣe pàtàkì ni kí a fi àpẹrẹ àwọn ọmọ tí ò kópa nínú ìdarapọ̀ mó èyàn nígbàtí wọ́n dàgbà nítorí àidásí, oríburúkú àti iṣilò.
column3: Ìmọ̀ràn tí ó ṣe pàtàkì jùlọ tí a máa ń lò láti fi hàn pé ó ṣe pàtàkì láti mú ọmọ dàgbà pẹ̀lú àwọn àgbà ni láti gbé àwọn àpẹẹrẹ kan kalẹ̀ nípa àwọn ọmọ tí kò dàgbà pẹ̀lú àwọn àgbà nítorí àìlègbẹ̀yìn, àìlègbẹ̀yìn, tàbí àìlègbẹ̀yìn.

column1: English: Nevertheless, there are many distinctive ways of drinking coffee around the world that are worth experiencing. = Yoruba: Àmọ́sá, ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀nà ọ̀dọ̀ lówà láti fi mún kọfí káàkiri àgbáyé tí o ní láti nírìírí. ### English: The money could go toward flood-proof houses, better water management, and crop diversification. = Yoruba:
column2: Owó náà lè jẹ́ fún kíkọ́ ilé tágbàrá kò le wọ̀, tí yíò le sàkóso omi dáadáa òhun dídari ohun ọ̀gbìn.
column3: Ó lè lọ sí ilé tí kò ní bàjẹ́ nígbà tí òjò bá rọ̀, tí ó sì tún lè lọ sí ilé tí ó ní àyè láti mú omi tó tó láti fi ṣe omi tí a ó fi se oúnjẹ.

column1: English: By early today, winds were around 83 km/h, and it was expect to keep weakening. = Yoruba: Ní bí i ìdájí òní àfẹ́fẹ́ fẹ́ tó bí kìlómítà mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́rin láàrin wákàtí, a dẹ̀ retí pé agbára ẹ̀ á ma kéré sí. ### English: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store. = Yoruba:
column2: Ilé ìfowópamọ́sí tó wà ní erékùsù ní Stanley káàkiri ibi ìtajà ìwọ̀ oòrùn FIC nìkan ni o ti lè pààrọ̀ owó.
column3: Ìwòsàn lè wáyé ní ilé ìfowópamọ́ kan ṣoṣo tó wà ní erékùṣù náà, èyí tó wà ní Stanley, ní ìlà òsì ilé ìfowópamọ́ FIC West.

column1: English: Dr. Lee also expressed his concern about reports that children in Turkey have now become infected with the A(H5N1) avian influenza virus without becoming ill. = Yoruba: Dr.Lee náà fi ẹ̀dùn ọkàn hàn lórí ìrìyìn pé àwọn ọmọ tó wà ní ilẹ̀ Turkey ti kó kòkòrò A(H5N1) èyí tó jẹ́ ààrùn kòkòrò avian influenza láláì se àìsàn. ### English: Do not deface the site by marking or scratching graffiti into structures. = Yoruba:
column2: Máṣe bá ojú òpó náà jẹ́ nípa ṣíṣà mí si tàbí àwòrán tó wà ní ogiri.
column3: Ẹ má ṣe fi àmì tàbí àdàwólulẹ̀ kọlu àwọn ibi tí a ti ń ṣe iṣẹ́ náà.
